Students will get to hear from several craftsman on their best practices, best products to use, ink vs. paint, and how to spread inks in the best methods. Students will then get to practice making prints using their own blocks, purchased blocks or some from the shop. Come play! We will have sample fabric but silk can also be purchased on site!
fee_itemization: silk fabric, gold ink, paints and wood blocks

name: Being Your Persona
description_book: How to maintain the illusion at an event that you are a period person interacting with other period people.
description_web: How to maintain the illusion at an event that you are a period person interacting with other period people.

name: Putting it Together: STS3
description_book: Assemble your cut pieces into a shiny! This class is **required** for the "Sheet to Shiny" track. Bring something to work on. Tools are limited.
description_web: Assemble your cut pieces into a shiny! This class is **required** for the "Sheet to Shiny" track. Bring something to work on. Tools are limited, and there will be wait time between steps for some people. If you took the class previously, we will have to ask you not to participate if turnout is large.

name: Women in the Middle Ages
description_book: This is a mythbusting class on the role women played in the Middle Ages. Women fought, led men in battle, read, crafted, etc.
description_web: This is a mythbusting class on the role women played in the Middle ages. Women fought, led men in battle, read, crafted, etc. For every belief that women didn't do "that" in the Middle Ages, there was a woman who did.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Runes: The Elder & Anglo-Saxon/Frisian *Futharks*
description_book: Origins and usage of *futharks*, including mercantile, cyphers and codes, magic, "this is mine!", rune names, and more.
description_web: From the earliest identifiable runic inscriptions to their decline, the Elder and the Anglo-Saxon/Frisian were the commonly used characters in epigraphic inscriptions. We will look at rune origins and meanings, use in trade and identifying goods, codes and cyphers, magic, regional variations, and the *bracteate* tradition, as well as other venues.

name: Slaves and Freedpersons in Ancient Rome
description_book: Slavery was a fact of life in ancient Rome, so what might a Roman persona be expected to know about it?
description_web: Slavery was a fact of life in ancient Rome, so what might a Roman persona be expected to know about it? Join us as we dispel the myths, face the facts and gain an understanding of how Roman people interacted with this challenging tradition.

name: Midrealm's Digital Alexandria
description_book: Come learn the Midrealm's newest online A&S resource! The Curator will discuss how to search and make submissions.
description_web: Digital Alexandria is a way of cataloging and storing the collective Arts & Sciences knowledge of the members of the SCA of the Middle Kingdom. How often have you wished to be able to read someone’s research, or attended a class only to have lost the handout? Maybe you want to start researching something but don’t know where to start? This website contains A&S projects that have been submitted by the users. You can search for projects by meta tag or feel free to “browse the stacks”.

name: Spinning 101
description_book: Learn to spin thread on a drop spindle. Class will include instruction on making and using a low-whorl drop spindle.
fee_itemization: Fee is for drop spindle, spinning supplies, and handouts.

name: Armor Repair for Beginners
description_book: Covers the basics of armor repair and how armor repair becomes armor construction.
description_web: Did you arrive at an event to find your armor has a broken strap, a popped rivet, or some other damage you didn't notice from the last time you used it? Did you feel or hear a piece of your armor come loose or break when you took that last hit? Did a marshal tell you to fix it before you come back on the field, and you're not sure how, and everyone who does know how is still on the field? This class teaches you how to assemble a basic armor repair kit, the tools and supplies you need to do basic, safe, legal repairs to your own armor, and get you back on the field. We also show how these simple, basic repairs are a starting point to building your own armor. We also cover basic helm safety including padding and strapping.

name: The Pennsic Mightier: Improv Workshop
description_book: Improv workshop for experienced performers to address higher level improv skills for creating character and building scenes leading to a performance.
description_web: This improv workshop is designed to address intermediate and advanced level improv skills focused on creating unique characters, building relationships, committing to a scene, and exploring long-form improv. Long-form improv is a building block for work in *commedia* and sketch comedy. The character and scene work will improve your overall acting skills as well as building confidence in everyday life. This workshop will culminate in a performance on Friday at 4 PM in the Performing Arts Tent; however, the performance is optional if you would prefer to attend the workshops without performing live. You must have prior improv experience (mundane experience or prior Pennsic classes, etc.) and be familiar with the basics of “Yes, and” to participate in this class. Those without experience may be allowed at the instructor’s discretion. You do not have to attend every workshop; however, different skills will be addressed each day and attendance at all is beneficial. The Friday workshop is mandatory if you would like to perform in the show. This class is for ages 18 and up; however, younger students may be allowed with both parental and instructor permission. Please attend the first workshop (with a parent, for those under 18) or contact the instructor in advance to participate.

name: Making Herbal Sachets
description_book: Simple class on creating herbal sachets; even the youngest child can go home with a little pouch of sweet-smelling herbs.
description_web: Simple class on creating herbal sachets; even the youngest child can go home with a little pouch of sweet-smelling herbs.

name: Learn to Play Nine Men’s Morris Medieval Game
description_book: Learn and play Nine Men’s Morris. There will be a raffle at the end to give away 3 of the games!
description_web: Learn and play Nine Men’s Morris. There will be a raffle at the end to give away 3 of the games!

name: Tarot the Card Game
description_book: A simple trick-taking card game played with a tarot deck, fun for children and adults.

name: Dots, Lines, and Stuff: Learn to Read Music
description_book: Are you an absolute beginner or an experienced bard? Come learn the basics of how to read music in an hour.
description_web: Are you an absolute beginner or an experienced bard? Come learn the basics of how to read music in an hour. The ability to read modern music is valuable to bards and others who want to understand both modern and medieval music. It is an essential skill for taking the next step as well as reading and transcribing music written in the various medieval notations and tablatures.

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. String provided as part of the class fee.

name: A Manuscript of a Different Color
description_book: An historical overview of illuminated manuscripts on dyed vellum and how to imitate the effect on pergamenata for SCA scribal projects.

name: Medieval Weeds and Why They Grow
description_book: Learn about four medieval weeds which you can find here in northeastern North America and why they grow!
description_web: Come learn about four medieval weeds which you can find here in northeastern North America (and elsewhere) and why they grow! We will discuss the plant itself, a little history, past and modern uses, and how you can use the plant to learn something about your own back yard. If we have time, we will cover one surprise weed.

instructor: Lady Maire ni Cathal Ui Chonchobar
name: Origami Dragon
description_book: Students will learn how to make a dragon with flapping wings. Directed at youth, but adults welcome.
description_web: Students will learn how to make a dragon with flapping wings. Directed at youth, but adults welcome.

name: Recipes from the 1549 *Banchetti*
description_book: A pottage of figs, spinach in sauce, and a large tart of eggs, milk, raisins, sugar, and pine nuts.

name: Midrealm College of Heralds Restructure Plan
description_book: For Midrealm heralds interested in changes coming to the structure of the Kingdom College of Heralds.
description_web: Midrealm Heralds! We will soon be instituting a ranking structure and authorization process for court and book heralds. Come learn what's coming for your office and for the Heralds-at-Large.

name: Wee Beasties: Yeast and Brewing of Medieval Beers
description_book: A discussion of various types of yeasts available for the SCA brewer to use.
description_web: A discussion of various types of yeasts available for the SCA brewer to use. Species, what they are used for, pitching and fermentation management, and where to obtain them. As Brewers, we make wort. The Wee Beasties make the beer!

name: Basic Rattan Weapon-Making for the Beginner
description_book: Learn the basics of making the rattan weapons used in SCA heavy fighting.
description_web: Are you new to fighting and want to learn the basics of making your own equipment? Did you ever try to make a weapon only to have it fail inspection at the first event you brought it to? Is your first weapon nearing the end of its life, and you're not sure where to start building a new one? Did you spend the money on rattan to make a sword, and you're afraid that you'll waste it because you're not sure what you're doing? Do you need a sword in an hour, and have the materials, but not the know-how or extra hands to make one? This is the class for you! In this class, we take you from bare stick to inspection-ready weapon in under an hour. Great for the beginner or the fighter who needs a replacement weapon in a hurry. If you bring a stick, we will have the tape, thrusting tips, and tools on hand to help you start building.

name: Spies and Secret Codes
description_book: Youth Class on different period secret codes used in various militaries and how to make your own.
description_web: Youth Class on different period secret codes used in various militaries and how to make your own.

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Gothic Hybrid Drolleries and Grotesques
description_book: Where the ideas for the fantastic creatures in the margins of illuminations came from and why they are there. Short drawing exercise at end of class.
description_web: Have you ever wondered where the ideas for the fantastic creatures often found hiding in the margins of illuminations came from? Do they serve a purpose other than making people giggle? Find out the answers to these questions and more. And, if you'd like, participate in a fun little drawing exercise.
fee_itemization: 5 page (double sided) handout and a hand bound flip book for creating original grotesques

name: Telling Bardic Tales in Persona
description_book: Do you want to tell better stories at Bardic Events? Do you have a hard time keeping stories consistent with your persona? This class is for you!
description_web: This is a class about telling better tales, and keeping those tales in line with your SCA persona. This includes tips on writing original bardic works that fit with your time period and persona, and what stories written by others would have been commonly told around the fire on pilgrimages, on campaign, or by wandering bards looking to earn a meal, a place by the hearth, or some hard coin.

name: Help Me, Tempus, You’re My Only Hope!
description_book: Two hours with Tempus, anything sewing. Trouble-shooting, problem-solving, garb problems diagnosed and solutions proffered. Maybe learn to sew....
description_web:
(Garb Troubleshooting/Q&A Workshop)
This is a trouble-shooting and problem-solving class; garb problems diagnosed and solutions proffered. Bring to the class garb that went “wrong” or garb that didn’t “work” for you. We'll talk; it can be fixed. If you don’t have the garb here, bring your questions; we’ll do our best to solve your garb troubles. We’ll talk about gussets and how to use your seam ripper, too. This class can go on longer if needed. Also, this class will be offered next year.

name: Throw Away Your Wristwatch
description_book: Learn period methods of timekeeping to tell time day and night at Pennsic. Discussion of scientific principles so you can tell time anywhere, anytime.
fee_itemization: 30 page color booklet. Cardboard nocturnal. A stick.

name: Low, Slow and Flirtatious for Three: *Pelligrina*
description_book: Highly seductive, this is an intermediate *bassadanza* for three. Dancers should be familiar with *doppii, sempii, saltarelli*, and *riprese*.
description_web: Highly seductive, this is an intermediate *bassadanza* for three. Dancers should be familiar with *doppii, sempii, saltarelli*, and *riprese*.

name: Open Crafting Time
description_book: Family Point is open for parent-guided crafts. We will have a craft and instructions, but there will not be a teacher to guide the activity.

name: Beginning Knitting
description_book: Learn to knit. Needles and yarn provided, but if you have a favorite color bring your own skein of worsted weight yarn.

name: Introduction to *Go*
description_book: A basic introduction to rules and play of the Japanese/Chinese game of *go* / *weiqi*.
description_web: Will teach the rules of the Japanese game *go* (also known as *weiqi* in China), and offer a chance to play afterwards.

name: Family Stick Weaving
description_book: Family-oriented stick weaving. Youth welcome with parent or guardian.
description_web: Family-oriented stick weaving, a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Up-gradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Fee covers sticks and string; take your work home with you. Youth welcome with parent or guardian.

location: The Encampment of Erica Paige (Erica Paige)
name: Introduction to Spinning *Poi*
description_book: Basic moves and terminology to get you spinning safely.

name: Open Scribal Time
description_book: Take advantage of our clean, well-lit space to work on existing projects or to try your hand at calligraphy and/or illumination.

name: Oval Market Basket (Part 3, Rim and Handle)
description_book: Basket weaving class taught in 3 parts. In part 3, we will be weaving the rim and adding a handle. You must have your sides built before we start.
description_web: Make-and-take basket weaving class taught in three parts. In part 1 ($6), we will build the base of the basket. In part 2 ($8), we will be adding spokes and weaving the sides. In part 3 ($6), we will be weaving the rim and adding a handle. Please plan to take the classes in order. Total for all three classes is $20.
fee_itemization: Materials Fee covers the cost of the reed and printing of handouts.

name: Flirtation *à Trois: Belfiore*
description_book: My reconstruction of the flirtatious 15th-century threesome, *Belfiore*, a popular, highly entertaining dance! All levels welcome!
description_web: My reconstruction of the flirtatious 15th-century threesome, *Belfiore*, a popular, highly entertaining dance! All levels welcome!

name: *Keum-Boo*: Hot Metal Gilding
description_book: *Keum-Boo*, or hot metal gilding, is gilding on silver, copper or iron with 24-karat gold foil, while the base metal is at 500 degrees Fahrenheit.
description_web: *Keum-Boo*, or hot metal gilding, is a Korean method of gilding on silver, copper or iron with 24-karat gold foil, while the base metal is at 500 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Volunteering and You
description_book: Suffering from Helium-Hand? Want to volunteer but new? Worried about burn-out? Look no further! This class covers volunteering while self-caring.
description_web:
Are you suffering from Helium-Hand Syndrome? Want to volunteer but don't know where to start? Worried about burning yourself out? Look no further!
This class covers the Hows and Whys, the advantages, pitfalls and rewards of volunteering, without sacrificing your health along the way.

name: An Introduction  to Roman-Style Scrolls
description_book: This class will introduce scribes to an assortment of images based on Roman murals, paint a Roman motif and explore Roman calligraphy.
description_web: This class will introduce scribes to an assortment of images based on Roman murals, paint a Roman motif and explore Roman calligraphy. We will have the opportunity to discuss sources as well as defining styles and characteristics of Roman art. We'll practice some of those techniques while creating a small painted motif. Please bring your scribal kits if you have them; some supplies will available to borrow.
fee_itemization: Pre-traced motif on pergamenata with color copy sample

name: Yoga for Relaxation and Recovery
description_book: Gentle yoga practice offered before dinner, M, W, F in Atlantian Royal. Bring your mat and dress to flex. Low and slow practice for Pennsic pain.
description_web: A gentle yoga practice offered for those who aren't up early and prefer a before-dinner option. Repeating dates under the big tent in Atlantian Royal encampment, facilitated by a combination of teachers. Bring your yoga mat and wear comfortable clothing that allows flexibility. M, W, F Peace and War Week. This is a low and slow practice targeting everything that hurts from Pennsic setup, walking, and activities.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. A modern system for rune magic.
description_web: In period, runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows, for example, how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to hear even at distance, or to awaken inanimate objects. This is a system of energy manipulation using runes and another set of symbols. This workshop introduces the symbols and what each of them is used for, and includes the attunement. It does *not* include introduction to runes. You may take this workshop without knowing the runes, but you will need to learn them to be able to use this system. You will be able to use this technique immediately.

name: Tavern Games
description_book: We'll review a number of popular period tavern games involving gambling and/or drinking. Plenty of time to play will be given. **Age 18+**.
description_web: We'll review a number of popular period tavern games including board games, dice games, and card games. We will allow plenty of time to play. Discussions about drinking and gambling may occur, so **18+** age only, please.

name: Tool Making for Engraving: Chasing and *Repoussé*
description_book: Learning to make gravers and punches used in engraving and *repoussé* work. Students will produce their own engravers and punches.
description_web: Learning to make gravers and punches used in engraving and *repoussé* work. Students will produce their own engravers and punches.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

name: Welcome to War T(w)een Mixer
description_book: Join us at Family Point for a chance to meet other teens and 'tweens at Pennsic. Open for those aged 10-17. All curfew and supervision rules apply.
description_web: Join us at Family Point for a chance to meet other teens and 'tweens at Pennsic. We provide lights, power, and snacks; you provide charging cables and conversation. Open for those 10-17 years of age. All curfew and supervision rules must be followed.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of War--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of War--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: 12-step recovery meeting. This is an open meeting for those involved in a 12-step program. It is run on an agnostic format.
description_web: 12-step recovery meeting. This is an open meeting for those involved in a 12-step program. It is run on an agnostic format.

name: *Études* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude* 1 is more linear; *Étude* 2 adds off-line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Morning Session, Youth Combat Open Field
description_book: Morning drills and skills session for youth heavy list fighters. Castle Battle may pre-empt one morning. Check in with YC for details.
description_web: Morning drills and skills session for youth heavy list fighters. Castle Battle may pre-empt one morning. Check in with YC for details.

name: Rune Interpretation
description_book: New to runes? Learn what the runes mean for divination; covers the *Elder Futharc* and, if there's time, the extra runes on the Anglo-Frisian set.
description_web: New to the runes? Learn what the runes mean for divination. We'll cover the *Elder Futharc* (24) and, if there is time, the extra runes from the Anglo-Frisian *Futhorc*.

name: Beginning *Kute Uchi*: Japanese Hand-Looping
description_book: Learn the four basic moves of this loop manipulation used in many of the historic braids from the Shoisoin Temple. Auditors welcome.

name: *Meigaku*: Design and Document Japanese Names
description_book: Learn how to design, document, and register with the College of Arms a Japanese name which is appropriate for a particular time and social role.
description_web: Do you want to design a Japanese personal name which is appropriate for a particular time and social role? Do you want to design a Japanese group name for your war band or theater troupe? Are you a herald who wants to increase your repertoire of culture-specific naming practices? Would you like to know how rank, title, and office relate to all of this and how to include them in people's names? Would you like to learn how to pronounce Japanese names and summon people into court? Then this class is for you! Learn how the structure of Japanese personal and group names varied by time, period, and social status. Learn to design pre-modern names and attach titles.
fee_itemization: There will be a multi-page handout.

name: Embroidery: How Do I Do That!?!
description_book: Embroidery for the absolute beginner. Come out and learn a few easy stitches!
description_web: Embroidery for the absolute beginner. Do you want to decorate your garb or projects but aren't sure where to start? Come learn a few easy stitches. See some examples of basic embroidery projects. Sample fabric, needle and thread provided. Please bring scissors and a small embroidery hoop if you have them. Strict limit of 10 students! Handouts will be given to everyone but kits and hands-on teaching will be limited to 10.
fee_itemization:
Embroidery floss
Needles
Hoops
Sample fabric

name: Blade Face Inlay: Lecture and Demo
description_book: Class 1 of 2. Examination of inlay and overlay techniques for blades. This is a pre-requisite for "Blade Face Inlay: Practicum."
description_web: Class 1 of 2. We will examine period techniques for inlay and overlay of blade faces. Example pieces will be drawn from Norse blades, High Medieval English small knives, and 16th-century Ottoman and Iranian work. Techniques will be demonstrated. Pre-requisite for Blade Face Inlay: Practicum.
fee_itemization: Estimated 9 pages / color print, Fedex printing quote 65¢/color page = $5.85 round to even at $6.

name: Running or Winning Siege Cooking Contests
description_book: How to run, enter and win "siege cooking" contests, from picking the foods to handout to adding theater to your entry.
description_web: "Siege cooking" contests pit contestants, provided with identical raw ingredients, against each other or a pre-announced standard. A popular feature of weekend events, such contests can spice up a household dinner or provide the entire feast. The instructor has run the Maison Rive siege cooking contest at Pennsic for more than twenty years now; learn what worked and what didn't from both sides of the judging table.

name: Plagues of Europe: Really, There Was More Than One
description_book: Focuses on the types of plagues, their origins, biological mechanisms, means of transmission and long term impact on the affected populations.
description_web: Measles, small pox, bubonic plague and leprosy each had a devastating impact on the affected population physically, psychologically, spiritually, and economically. This class focuses on the origins, biological mechanisms, means of transmission and long term impact on the affected populations. When early man lived in relatively isolated groups, contact between individuals was infrequent and short-lived diseases (for either the disease or the host) were not able to spread by direct contact or through intermediaries such as rats, mosquitoes, etc. As people began to live closer together in towns, later in cities, and when lack of sanitation became more of a threat to health, transmission of diseases became easier and more common. Resistant individuals lived and the less-resistant died, thus selectively increasing resistance in the population as a whole. The gradually declining death toll seen in recurrences of a particular plague was due to an increase in resistance within the population due to several factors. Modern medical investigations indicate that the same genetic makeup that allowed some people to survive or avoid bubonic plague are the same genetic makeup that allows some people be HIV positive and not develop AIDS.
fee_itemization: Printed handouts of 16-18 pages includes some color pages. Limited number of printed handouts and available online.

name: Twelve Plants through the Ages: Year 3
description_book: Follow twelve plants through time from Celsus to the modern day. How plants were used for medicine in period, and how that is supported today.
description_web: Follow twelve plants through time from Celsus to the modern day. What plants were used medicinally in period, and which of these uses have been proven by contemporary science. I am covering 12 plants this year which are different from the previous two years of plants covered by this class. This is a historical overview of uses, and does not constitute medical advice.

name: Roman Rag Doll Make-and-Take
description_book: Make and take a Roman rag doll based on an extant item in the British Museum collection. Animal-free kit provided to make and clothe one doll, no cost
description_web: Make and take a Roman rag doll based on an extant item in the collection of the British Museum. Kit provided at no cost to make and clothe one doll per participant. Accessibility: needles will be pre-threaded, and dolls can be made completely by hand from scratch or from a pre-sewn body that only needs stuffing. Kit will contain no animal products/fibers. Participants are welcome to drop in and out during the class period. No cost.

name: Silk Flowers from Thread: *Passementerie*
description_book: Hands-on construction of 3-dimensional flowers using thread (embroidery floss), velum, and wire. Low Countries 15th-16th centuries.
description_web: Hands-on construction of 3-dimensional flowers using thread (embroidery floss), velum, and wire. Low Countries 15th-16th century. Several *Besloten Hofje* shrines are intact and are comprised of tiny flowers: petals cut from velum and wrapped in thread, supported by wire. Create your own flowers to use as decoration or accessories (though you probably won't be able to complete one in class).
fee_itemization: Full color 20 page printed instructions, vellum, silk, wire and purl, needle, little metal charms, and use of sissors. Extra supplies will be available

name: Street Smarts
description_book: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography: how the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.
description_web: What's in a name? A folkloric history of Pennsic geography: how the streets and areas of Pennsic came by their distinctive designations.

name: Mustards  and Saunces Roundtable 101
description_book: Informal meeting for those interested in making mustards and sauces, as well as comparing mustards made a year ago, six months ago and two weeks ago.
description_web: Mustard? Informal meeting for those interested in making mustards and sauces. We'll compare mustards made a year ago, six months ago and two weeks ago to notice taste differences. Not all mustard samples will be from period recipes. We highly encourage folks, if they so desire, to bring samples of mustards and sauces they have made. Not required at all but the more things to sample the better! We will be making up booklets to hand out at class. If any *mustardiers*  or *sauciers* have recipes to share, please contact me at scadianbooks@gmail.com to have these included in the booklet.

name: Lyric Writing Workshop: Part 1
description_book: Got a song in your heart? Dai and Líadan of Bed 'n' Breakfast teach lyric-writing techniques to craft your first draft and quash songwriter's block.
description_web: Got a song in your heart? Dai and Líadan of Bed 'n' Breakfast teach lyric-writing techniques to help you craft a first draft. Song structure, brainstorming for three verses and a chorus, when and how to build bridges and bending clichés, internal and external rhyme patterns, emphasis. Quash songwriter's block forever. Attendees must be prepared to leave with homework and return for Part 2: Lyric Editing.

name: Empty Tent Place Holder - 2 Hours
description_book: Keeps a tent open next to a loud class.

name: Anglo-Saxon Ring Pouch
description_book: Create the only pouch an Anglo-Saxon woman would ever want or need, using period supplies and sewing techniques.
fee_itemization: All of the supplies and materials needed to make a ring pouch.

name: Cables for Intermediate Knitters
description_book: Covers the basic principles of cable knitting, including how to read cabling patterns. We'll practice by starting a simple head band.
description_web: This class will open the door to the basic principals of cable knitting, including how to read cabling patterns. We will have a chance to practice by starting a simple head band which you can finish at your leisure. I hope this class will entice you to look for ways to integrate cables in your future knitting projects.
fee_itemization: Handout, 2 knitting needles, 1 cable needle and yarn

name: Ealdormere Day
description_book: Ealdormere sponsors Family Point for the day! Activities TBD.

name: Period Card Games: *Karnoffel*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this oldest identifiable European card game (1426 reference).
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this oldest identifiable European card game (1426 reference).

name: SCA Steel Fighting Experiment
description_book: SCA-sanctioned experiment to evaluate bringing steel fighting into the Society. There will be demos and fighting practice for interested parties.
description_web: SCA-sanctioned experiment to evaluate bringing steel fighting into the Society. There will be demos of fighting, armor and weapons, as well as practice. Single combat only. Non-SCA Steel fighters are welcome. For more information contact Duke Michael of Bedford. Strawberry Fields B6. bolt_ml@yahoo.com.

name: Viking-Age Clay Pot Cooking
description_book: Learn how to cook lunch in a clay pot. There will be a selection of ingredients, a fire, and information.
description_web: Learn how to cook lunch in a clay pot. There will be a selection of ingredients, a fire, and information. I will have a class set of specially-priced small Viking-age pots available at Irontree Works merchant booth, and there will be a class fee for supplies. We will talk about what ingredients were available where during the Viking Age, sources, and cooking methods. Ten students will leave class with a pot of cooked lunch.
fee_itemization: Fee will pay for charcoal and food ingredients. Students will also need to purchase or have a small Viking Age pot, which are available for a special class price at the booth.

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Class limited to 10 looms.

name: Portraits
description_book: How to draw portraits of people. Guided practice in the development of those skills. Bring materials; some limited supplies will be available.
description_web: How to draw portraits of people. What are the specific things that you need to look for that changes a base portrait in order to "read" as a specific person? This class will guide you strategies, guidelines and practice in the development of those skills. Bring drawing materials, pencils, pastels, charcoal and paper of your choice. Some limited supplies will be available.﻿

name: Toddler Playgroup
description_book: Let our toddlers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends!
description_web: Let our toddlers tire each other out! Let the parents and guardians make friends!

name: *Kamon*: Designing and Documenting Japanese Armory
description_book: Make "Individually Attested Patterns" work for you! Learn to use online resources to design, document, and register a pre-modern Japanese *kamon*.
description_web: Do you want to design and register real Japanese heraldic designs called *kamon*? Are you a herald who wants to increase your repertoire of culturally specific heraldic design resources? Then this class is for you. Learn how to use online resources to design, document, and register a pre-modern Japanese *kamon*.
fee_itemization: There will be a multipage handout.

name: Beginning Appliqué, Cording and Couching
description_book: Learn a method of decorating fabric that can be used for clothing, pouches, pillows, cloaks and more.
description_web: In this class you can learn a method of decorating fabric that can be used for clothing, banners, pouches, pillows, cloaks and more. You will learn the basics of applying fabric shapes to a background fabric, then applying a cord and securing it around the edges of the appliqué. Basic sewing knowledge is helpful but anyone can learn this technique. All materials provided. Bring small scissors if you have them.

name: Introduction to Chess Fundamentals
description_book: Learn how to play this game of royal battle! We cover the basics to allow you to have a fun game with anyone. For ages 14-17.
description_web: Learn how to play this game of royal battle! We cover the basics to allow you to have a fun game with anyone. For ages 14-17.

name: Justinian’s Plague and The Great Mortality
description_book: Come learn about flagellants, fleas, *tarbagans*, plague saints, and what Empress Theodora did with her three orifices.
description_web: Come learn about flagellants, fleas, *tarbagans+, plague saints, and what Empress Theodora did with her three orifices.

name: Puzzles!
description_book: Come in and solve some puzzles, some ancient in origin and others relatively new.
description_web: Come in and solve some puzzles, some ancient in origin and others relatively new. I'll have physical ones such as the Tavern puzzles, Irish Lovers Linking Rings or construction puzzles; paper-based ones such as math and logic puzzles; verbal puzzles as told by bards and storytellers around the campfire.

name: Speaking Shakespeare
description_book: Students review the basics of iambic pentameter and do readings which illustrate how the Bard varies the verse to give stage directions to the actor.
description_web: After reviewing the basics of iambic pentameter (the form Shakespeare used most often), students will do readings which illustrate how the Bard varies the verse to give "stage directions" to the actor.

name: Where's Lord Waldo?
description_book: A look at the history and trivia of SCA geography.
description_web: A look at the history and trivia of SCA geography.

name: Hammer of the Witches: Witch Hunts and Trials
description_book: Examines the various texts, tactics, and histories of witch-hunters, along with information on the enemies they believed they fought.

name: Open Knitting Circle
description_book: Stuck on a project? Need help understanding a pattern or just want to knit and chat with others? Come and join a knitter's circle.
description_web: Stuck on a project? Need help understanding a pattern or just want to knit and chat with others? Come and join a knitter's circle.

instructor: Baroness Cellach Dhonn inghean Mhic an
name: New to the SCA
description_book: You're new to the SCA. What you need to know? Come with questions.
description_web: You're new to the SCA. What you need to know? Come with questions.

name: Viking Beads for Youth
description_book: Make your own Viking beads to take home. Learning about shapes, colors and what was most popular, using "Play-Doh". (Limit of 12.)
description_web: Make your own Viking beads to take home. Learning about shapes, colors and what was most popular using the kid-friendly medium of "Play-Doh". Because of that, please send your children with either a smock or in garb you do not mind getting a little messy in case of enthusiastic artists! (Limit of 12)

location: Herald's Point ( Intersection of the Low Road with the Great Eastern Highway, next to Family Point)
name: Topics in Basic Heraldry
description_book: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory skills for consulting at Pennsic Herald's Point. Dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point.
description_web: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory submission skills necessary to consult at Pennsic Herald's Point. Exact dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point at the beginning of the War. All newer heralds are strongly encouraged to attend at least one of these classes prior to volunteering at Herald's Point.

name: Japanese Stab Book Binding
description_book: Assemble your own book with Japanese stab book binding. Learn this simple but elegant book binding style in an hour.
description_web: Assemble your own book with Japanese stab book binding. Learn this simple but elegant book binding style in an hour.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this seven-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may view a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, date, time, and location will be announced.

name: Pennsic Known World Choir
description_book: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested, adult singers! This year's concert theme is "Songs of Food and Drink."
description_web: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested, adult singers! This year's concert theme is "Songs of Food and Drink." The repertoire includes pieces by Palestrina, Lassus, Ravenscroft, Bateson and others. Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on Thursday evening of War Week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is helpful, but not required if you learn the music in advance. Sheet music and audio tracks are available online at https://bit.ly/2TQZuoy. Pre-registration is requested although not required (on the Pennsic War web site). Please bring a 1" or ½” black folder for your music and a pencil.
fee_itemization: Limited extra music is available for $3 per set.

name: Through the Looking Glass: New World Civilizations
description_book: Learn about vast cities, complicated engineering, and sophisticated civilizations that thrived in period in North America.
description_web: Sixteenth-century Spanish explorers, as they moved across North America, encountered vast cities, complicated engineering, and remnants of sophisticated civilizations. Learn about the First Nations peoples that thrived in period within the eastern half of North America and their accomplishments that are oftentimes forgotten in main stream history texts.

name: Beaded Flowers 1: Rose
description_book: Make a miniature rose in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nose pliers/wire cutters, bring them to class.
description_web: Make a miniature rose in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nosed pliers/wire cutters, please bring them to class. Not recommended for youth.

name: Early Bird Tournament 15
description_book: Pick fights, take names and get acquainted.
description_web: Pick fights, take names and get acquainted. The purpose of this tourney isn't to win the most bouts, but to find the most interesting facts about your opponents. **"More talk! Less fighting!"** Who will the MIC give the bird to this year?

location: Speckulian (W10 - Roman Road - Next to the large ROME Camp.)
name: Meditation, Emotional Freedom and Self Empowerment
description_book: Learn simple, proven, meditation techniques for emotional freedom, joy, and self empowerment.
description_web:
Learn simple, proven, meditation techniques for emotional freedom, joy, and self empowerment. Practical breathing, mindset, and self-actualization methods will be presented, along with a group practice and energy session.

It is best to come on an empty stomach, four hours from a big meal, or two hours from a light snack (like a piece of fruit).

*"Pennsic University does not advocate the adoption of any diagnostic method or course of treatment not performed by properly licensed practitioners in accordance with modern world medical (or legal) standard of care. This class will present medically (or legally) significant information for purely informational purposes only. The University strongly recommends that you always inform, and obtain advice from, modern world medical (or legal) professionals before altering or starting any course of diagnosis or treatment (or engaging in any legal practice) based on this class."*

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk you will likely learn different things!

name: *Mehteran*: Ottoman Janissary Band
description_book: The *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* studies music and history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band of the 14th-17th c. for performance at Pennsic.
description_web: The *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* (Ottoman Janissary Band) studies music and history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band from the 14th-17th century. The *Mehteran* will learn the historic Ottoman songs, *Ceddin Deden*, *Osman Pasa*, and *Ahmed Nesim-i* and  played on *zurna, davul*, horns, cymbals, and kettledrums, and sung by a choir, and will learn the historic Janissary march for performance at Pennsic. Brass horn players, percussionists and singers are welcome and encouraged to participate. Further details on the *Mehteran* Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/134233213955988/

name: A Hand A Day: Insular Majuscule
description_book: Learn the basics of the hand that is best known for its use in the Book of Kells and the Lindisfarne Gospels.

name: Parchment Making
description_book: Learn the basics of making parchment in one day.
description_web: Learn the basics of making parchment for bookbinding and award scrolls in one day. This 6-hour workshop will cover all of the steps, tools, equipment, and some variations on the process from fresh hides to finished sheets. The first part of the class shares techniques with leather and rawhide preparation, the last half is specific to parchment. Be as hands-on or hands-off as you want. We will provide gloves and aprons; you must bring boots or shoes that can be easily washed. Wear mucky clothes. Students who would like to continue working on the project and gain more experience may attend preparation hours on the days before and after class is held.

name: *De Lapidibus*
description_book: A class on gemstones, taught in (Muslim) persona, based on period sources.
description_web: A class on gemstones, taught in (Muslim) persona, based on period sources.
fee_itemization: no materials, probably a one page handout. No fee for handout.

name: *Iki*: Composing Japanese Scroll Texts
description_book: Compose better Japanese scroll texts. An introduction to the structure, style, and attestation of official Japanese correspondence and proclamations.
description_web: An introduction to Japanese diplomata along with the methods by which they are attested and delivered. The structure of Japanese official documents and correspondence is rather different from the textual style in Society documents, letters, and public announcements. This class introduces Japanese epistolatory style and the structures commonly found in official documents. This class will also introduce a few Japanese words which might appear as the header for an official document and several stylistic features of official Japanese writing both in Japanese and in English.
fee_itemization: There will be a multi-page handout.

name: Hand-Sewing 101
description_book: A discussion and hands-on of hand-sewing of garb, etc. This is not embroidery, but useful stitches. Please bring needle, thread and light cloth.

name: New Medieval Stories
description_book: I have written stories with a medieval background. They are suitable for ages 10 and above.
description_web: I have written stories with a medieval background. They are suitable for ages 10 and above. I wanted to share them with people who like the medieval period as much as I do.

name: Riding in Front of the Prince
description_book: How did 16th-C riders show off their own riding skills and their mount's best abilities to royalty?
description_web: During the 16th century, riding evolved from its martial origins into an art form practiced by noblemen and kings. Instead of the medieval jousts and melées, horsemen began to display their skills in carousels, ballets, and individual performances. The riding masters of the mid-16th century had definite ideas of what was proper for both horse and rider. During this class we will review different documentations about how riders showed off their own riding skills and their mount's best abilities to the royalty. We will cover how to prepare and train for this kind of performance, including what documentation is required for the judges.

name: Hedeby Apron: A Simple Construction
description_book: A new cutting/sewing layout for a Norse apron-dress, based on the Hedeby fragment. Only two measurements, one cut, and three seams!
description_web: A new cutting/sewing layout for a Norse apron-dress based on the Hedeby harbor fragment. We will briefly discuss the extant fragment and why it is interesting to the historical costumer. Then we'll learn how to construct the garment using a plausible construction/layout. Only two measurements, one cut, and three seams! Good for both beginning and advanced tailors.

name: Digital Heraldry
description_book: Drawing and editing heraldic devices digitally.
description_web: The Digital Age is upon us and it needs to interface with the Middle Ages. This class is mostly discussion but has some show-and-tell about using computers and tablets to draw heraldic art for submissions.
fee_itemization: Just to help defray the costs of copies.

name: How to Measure Yourself Plus Basic Patterning Tips
description_book: You will leave with a full set of your measurements and some basic knowledge of how patterns work, both commercial and homemade.
description_web: You will leave with a full set of your measurements and some basic knowledge of how patterns work, both commercial and homemade. Class fee includes twill tape with marked measurements. Free handout.
fee_itemization: 1 length of twill tape to record measurements

name: Event Finances: Before, During and After
description_book: From budget to gate to the event report. A discussion of event finances, based on Chapter 7 of the Exchequer's Handbook.

name: Medieval Soil Amendments
description_book: Discuss a variety of soil amendments used by medieval gardeners, why they were/are added/used from both a modern and medieval standpoint.
description_web: Come discuss a variety of soil amendments used by medieval gardeners, and talk about why they were/are added/used from both a modern and medieval standpoint. We will try to discuss at least four soil amendments, and possibly more if time permits.

name: Peerage Basics and Roundtable
description_book: A discussion-based roundtable for peers and non-peers. What is the peerage about and what can peers do better?
description_web: A discussion-based roundtable for peers and non-peers. What is the peerage about and what can peers do better? During this session, we will talk about the peerages, the highest awards in the SCA, and we will have peers there to talk about what their peerages mean to them and how the peerages have changed their SCA experiences. Given on behalf of Liam St Liam who can't make it to War this year.

instructor: Baroness Cellach Dhonn inghean Mhic an
name: Persona in the SCA
description_book: You have attended few events and your friends have a name, a device, and a persona. You feel you need one. This class is for you.
description_web: You have attended few events and your friends have a name, a device, and a persona. You feel you need one. What is a persona? Steps to developing a persona. Worksheet will be given.

name: Beginning *Atlatl*
description_book: Learn the basics of *atlatl* safety: how to hold the *atlatl*, load a dart, and throw the dart.
description_web: Learn the basics of *atlatl* safety: how to hold the *atlatl*, load a dart, and throw the dart.

name: *Branles* I Learned from Arbeau
description_book: *Branles*, group dances from France, as learned from *Orchésographie* by Thoinot Arbeau, with some details you might not have learned before.

name: "Pit and Pebble" Games (*Mancala*)
description_book: We will review basic *mancala* rules and discuss some variations. Ample time will be spent learning by playing.
description_web: We will review basic *mancala* rules and discuss some variations. Ample time will be spent learning by playing.

name: Archery Practice
description_book: Practice makes perfect. Don't forget, bragging rights are on the line here!

name: *Sprang* Basics
description_book: Using the twisted warp-based weaving of *sprang*, create a useful pouch.
description_web: Using the twisted warp-based weaving of *sprang*, create a useful pouch.

name: Open Scribal Time
description_book: Take advantage of our clean, well-lit space to work on existing projects or to try your hand at calligraphy and/or illumination.

name: I Spy: Calligraphy
description_book: Want your calligraphy look more “medieval"? Letters don't look quite right? Learn how to analyze calligraphy and take your letters to the next level.
description_web: Searching for ways to make your calligraphy look more “medieval"? Not sure why your letters don't look quite right? This class will show you how to analyze calligraphy and take your letters to the next level. Some calligraphy experience is helpful. This year, we will analyze the *littera textualis formata* script used in the *Hours of Catherine of Cleves* (MS M.0917/945), f. 208.

name: Concerning Mohammed and the Well-Guided Caliphs
description_book: A history of the early years of Islam, taught in persona from the standpoint of a later Muslim.
description_web: Concerning Our Lord the Prophet Mohammed (Blessings upon Him, his Kindred and his Companion Train) and the Well-Guided Caliphs. A history of the early years of Islam, taught in persona from the standpoint of a 12th-century North African Muslim.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Runes: the Younger *Futhark*
description_book: The YF and its many variants were primarily used in Scandinavia. Includes mercantile, pagan and Christian magic, codes, memorial stones, and more.
description_web: From the late Vendel period through medieval times (and actually in some regions of northern Norway and Sweden into the 20th century), Younger *Futhark* runes were pretty much cut-down versions derived from the Elder *Futhark*. We will look at the many variations not only in individual *futharks*, but regional variants in individual characters, rune names and meanings, pagan and Christian rune magic, mercantile usage, quickie notes scratched on slips of wood (Viking period Post-Its(R)), memorial stones, codes and cyphers, "handwriting" variants, and lots more.

name: Beginning Inkle Weaving
description_book: Learn to read inkle patterns, loom setup, weaves. Bring loom and shuttle, or borrow both. Bring two colors #10 crochet cotton, scissors, paper/pencil.
description_web: Learn to create beautiful trim for your garb. We will cover how to read an inkle pattern, how to set up and weave efficiently on the inkle loom. Bring your own loom and shuttle, or borrow one/both. Supplies needed: #10 cotton crochet thread/equivalent, in two colors; scissors; paper and pencil for notes.
fee_itemization:
handout, 4 pages
thread, 2 colors.  approximately 70 yards total per student

name: Blade Face Inlay: Practicum
description_book: Class 2 of 2. Inlay/overlay a *seax*. Work begins in class; finished in later sessions. “Blade Face Inlay: Lecture and Demo” is a pre-requisite.
description_web: Class 2 of 2. Students will inlay/overlay a provided *seax* blank. Work begins in class but will be finished in later sessions at the merchant booth, "A's Round Pottery" at student schedules. Students will leave with a completed *seax*. “Blade Face Inlay: Lecture and Demo” is a pre-requisite.
fee_itemization:
1084 Steel for seaxes, 36" length:			$13.68 + Shipping $26.88 = $40.56 / 9 = $4.50 
Silver for overlay (est 24" len 24ga wire):		$1.02 each. 
Propane for HT & mounting:					Approx $0.45. (Est)
Handle blocks (walnut):				$21.50 (no shipping) / 9 = $2.39 
Frankincense:					Approx $0.30 (Est)
Sandpaper usage:					Est $0.30.
Blade profile worksheets:				$0.13
Subtotal						$9.09
Round to even:					$9.00

name: Planning a Feast
description_book: How to design a menu, figure out how much to cook, plan logistics, and everything else you need to consider to ensure a successful feast.

name: Teen D&D Campaign: Face Red Hand Tribe
description_book: Be a Hero! Save the village of Kove Vale from goblins! Short D&D 3.5 campaign for ages 12-17. Must attend all sessions. No experience necessary.
description_web: Be a Hero! The Red Hand Tribe of Goblins have risen to become a major menace to Cove Vale. A few brave heroes are needed to push them back and make the vale safe for allied races again. Short D&D 3.5 campaign for ages 12-17. Must attend all sessions. No previous experience necessary.

name: Beginning Tablet Weaving
description_book: Introduction to tablet weaving. Participants will learn to string up their cards and weave a number of basic patterns. Limit 10. Observers welcome.

name: *Rusalki*: Not So Little Mermaids
description_book: The examination of *Rusalki* in Russian folk belief. Learn about mermaids without fish tails, but with awesome powers.

name: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater: Open Youth Rehearsal
description_book: Youth Readers' Theatre gives youth (ages 8-14) an opportunity of being in a low-stress theatre production, *The Goose Girl* by Gary L. Blackwood.
description_web: Known World Players, Youth Readers' Theatre, will give the youth (ages 8-14) an opportunity to experience a low-stress theatre experience by creating a staged reading of *The Goose Girl* by Gary L. Blackwood. A staged reading means that the actors will be performing the play with the script in hand. No audition necessary; attend both rehearsals. To be performed Friday, 8/4, in the Performing Arts Tent at 6:00 pm. *Children under 12, please bring a parent or guardian*.

name: Three Scandinavian Chests
description_book: I'll discuss the construction of three extant chests or boxes from Viking-era Scandinavia. All three are similar with minor differences.
description_web: I'll discuss the construction of three extant chests or boxes from Viking-era Scandinavia. All three are similar with minor differences. We'll discuss wood selection, tools needed, construction details and shortcuts and how to scale the sizes to fit your needs. Plans, drawings, etc., will be provided.

name: Tacketed Bookbinding: Medieval Account Books
description_book: A look at the history of an early "reusable" or "expandable" bookbinding technique. Sample book to examine.
description_web: A look at the history of an early "reusable" or "expandable" bookbinding technique. Used primarily for accounting books and ledger-type books, this style of bookbinding allowed the modification of the text block without major alteration of the actual covers of the book. There will be a sample of a tacketed book to examine.

name: Adjusting Cotehardies for Fuller Figures
description_book: A discussion on ways to make cotehardies/GFD look great on fuller figures, tricks to hide “problem areas”, how to deal with weight change, and more!
description_web: Do you like the look of the cotehardie/GFD, but think you can’t pull it off with your figure? Need some tips to make your cotes look great? Come discuss tricks to make the cotehardie look wonderful on fuller-figured folks, ways to hide “problem areas”, and what to do with weight gain or loss. Although the class will focus on fuller figures, all body types are welcome!

name: Cross Stitching 101: Getting Started
description_book: Learn the history of 15th-century cross stitching. Learn the basics in a hands-on class; make a two-colored simple pattern.
description_web: Learn the history of 15th-century cross stitching. Learn the basics in a hands-on class; make a two-colored simple pattern. Also, learn how to make your own patterns and how to size them. Kits will include everything you need to get started!
fee_itemization: Fabric square 2.50, Floss 1.50, Needle, Hoop 1.00, Small Scissors 1.50, Cloth pins .50, Handout copy 3.00

name: Favors and Tokens
description_book: A discussion on the meaning of favors and tokens and their uses within the SCA.
description_web: A discussion on the meaning of favors and tokens and their uses within the SCA.

name: Medieval Food for Newcomers
description_book: Let's talk about medieval food, its differences from and similarities to modern food, and resources. We'll also cook two or three simple dishes.
description_web: We'll talk about medieval food, how it is different from and similar to modern food; includes spices, and some accessible resources, both books and on the internet (and a reminder that not everything on the internet is true, even on the website of someone in the SCA). We'll also make two or three simple recipes with easy-to-find ingredients that aren't too different from some familiar dishes.
fee_itemization: handout cost of photocopying; materials cost of foodstuffs (eggs, herbs, noodles, Parmesan cheese, etc.)

name: Sketch Comedy
description_book: Come join The Hanging Jesters to learn to write and perform sketch comedy! We will be preparing for Pennsic Night Live!! Class is open to all!
description_web: Learn how to develop, write and perform scripts for sketch comedy. Learn how to make a lineup for performance, rehearsal, staging, and much more!

name: Embroidery: How Do I Do That!?!
description_book: Embroidery for the absolute beginner. Come out and learn a few easy stitches!
description_web: Embroidery for the absolute beginner. Do you want to decorate your garb or projects but aren't sure where to start? Come learn a few easy stitches. See some examples of basic embroidery projects. Sample fabric, needle and thread provided. Please bring scissors and a small embroidery hoop if you have them. Strict limit of 10 students! Handouts will be given to everyone but kits and hands-on teaching will be limited to 10.
fee_itemization:
Embroidery floss
Needles
Hoops
Sample fabric

name: Penta Pentamere Dance Class
description_book: There are three Penta Pentamere Dance CDs. Come and learn the dances and the history behind them.
description_web: There are three Penta Pentamere Dance CDs. Come and learn the dances and the history behind them. The dances will be chosen by the people who come to class. Yay, dancing!
fee_itemization: Description of dances and cd of the music

name: To Bow or Not To Bow
description_book: Class for all ages to help understand the ranks of our peers, how should they be addressed, and help reduce peer fear.
description_web: Class for all ages to help understand the ranks of our peers, how should they be addressed, and help reduce peer fear. It will also include how you comport yourself when first you are called unto court. Students will portray the parts of King/Queen, herald and person called into court. Open to all ages.

name: Introduction to Roman Cooking and Eating
description_book: Hands-on class featuring recipes from Apicius. Students will make the food, then recline and dine while learning about Roman dining customs.
description_web: Introductory level, hands-on class featuring recipes from Apicius. Students will participate in making a number of dishes to then be enjoyed while reclining on a triclinium, or three-sided Roman dining couch. While eating, we will discuss Roman dining customs and practices. **Allergy Alert: Some of the recipes featured will contain nuts.**
fee_itemization: $2 for recipes and dining customs hand outs, $3 for food materials used/consumed in class, totaling $5

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.

name: Æthelmearc-Sponsored Novelty Shoot
description_book: Daily novelty shoots hosted by the Kingdom of Æthelmearc. These shoots will be simple, fun shoots for any skill level.

name: A Historical Survey of Western Music Notation
description_book: The language of music has existed and evolved from ancient times. Come learn about its evolution with a focus on the Middle Ages.
description_web:
"…unless sounds are held by the memory of man, they perish, because they cannot be written down." – Isidore of Seville, music scholar, 7th century.

The language of music, i.e., music notation, has existed and evolved from ancient times. In this one-hour class, you will learn about its evolution with a focus on the Middle Ages.

name: Heraldry Design Basics
description_book: What better way to get your device submission in shape for Herald's Point, than by learning about heraldry design basics?
description_web: What better way to get your device submission in shape for Herald's Point than by learning about heraldry design basics? This class will include an introduction to device design based on the SCA rules of Heraldry. Some one-on-one assistance will be provided.

name: Shakespeare's *As You Like It*: The Messy Pastoral
description_book: In this class we'll discuss Shakespeare's comedy *As You Like It* and how it uses pastoral imagery to criticize contemporary social conditions.
description_web:
Ah, the forest of Arden, where Shakespeare's characters can escape the nasty politics of the court and instead enjoy a blissful countryside full of foul weather, wild animal attacks, and cruel landlords. In this class, I'll talk some about how the play uses pastoral images and tropes to highlight threats to rural life caused by the advent of enclosure and the rise of the commercial wool trade. We'll look at specific scenes and discuss the play's relationship to real life contexts in the late sixteenth/early seventeenth century. There will be time for general discussion of the play.  

Students do not need to have read the play in advance, but are encouraged to do so. A free e-text version is available at https://www.folgerdigitaltexts.org.

name: Exploring the **New** Heraldic Precedent Project
description_book: See the progress being made on the Heraldic Precedent Compilation Project, and learn how you can help!

name: Heraldic Wills and Permissions to Conflict
description_book: Help your clients with the why and how of filing these Administrative Actions with the College of Heralds.
description_web: For consulting heralds and submitters. How and why to submit Administrative Actions such as Permissions to Conflict and Heraldic Wills. Help your clients understand what they are, and why they are important. No class fee but donations to defray cost of handouts welcome.

name: The Pennsic Mightier: Improv Workshop
description_book: Improv workshop for experienced performers to address higher level improv skills for creating character and building scenes leading to a performance.
description_web: This improv workshop is designed to address intermediate and advanced level improv skills focused on creating unique characters, building relationships, committing to a scene, and exploring long-form improv. Long-form improv is a building block for work in *commedia* and sketch comedy. The character and scene work will improve your overall acting skills as well as building confidence in everyday life. This workshop will culminate in a performance on Friday at 4 PM in the Performing Arts Tent; however, the performance is optional if you would prefer to attend the workshops without performing live. You must have prior improv experience (mundane experience or prior Pennsic classes, etc.) and be familiar with the basics of “Yes, and” to participate in this class. Those without experience may be allowed at the instructor’s discretion. You do not have to attend every workshop; however, different skills will be addressed each day and attendance at all is beneficial. The Friday workshop is mandatory if you would like to perform in the show. This class is for ages 18 and up; however, younger students may be allowed with both parental and instructor permission. Please attend the first workshop (with a parent, for those under 18) or contact the instructor in advance to participate.

name: Basic Blacksmithing
description_book: The basics of blacksmithing from how to set up an affordable forge to the basics of making an "S" hook.
description_web: Come join us for a basic blacksmithing demo and some hands-on practice. Learn how to bend metal to your will. Brandr Aronsson will be making an "J"hook as part the demonstration and will be providing instruction and some hands-on experience.

name: Ealdormere Day
description_book: Ealdormere sponsors Family Point for the day! Activities TBD.

name: Morris Games
description_book: We will teach Nine Man's Morris and other games of that family (which include the modern tic-tac-toe).
description_web: We will teach Nine Man's Morris and other games of that family (which include the modern tic-tac-toe).

name: Recorder Jam with Siri! Part 2
description_book: Read through Renaissance 4 pt. recorder literature. Loaner SATB recorders available. Soprano recorders available for purchase, $4.
description_web: Play recorders with others in a group setting and read through Renaissance literature in four parts. Bring a music stand (some loaners available) and your instrument or use a loaner (Soprano, Alto, Tenor or Bass). You might wish to try a different instrument. New (Harmony brand) Soprano recorders will be available for $4.

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: *Romani*: An Introduction to Gypsy Personas
description_book: Want a Gypsy persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the Rom, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.
description_web: Want a Gypsy persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the Rom, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.

name: Longsword Against Rapier
description_book: How the longsword can be used against the rapier in the SCA lists.
description_web: How longsword can be used against rapier. How to apply various German techniques in the SCA list against single rapier and the various secondary weapons.

name: Abbreviations and Ligatures
description_book: An overview on the use of abbreviations and ligatures in period documents and possible uses in SCA-styled scrolls.
description_web: An overview on the use of abbreviations and ligatures in period documents and possible uses in SCA-styled scrolls. An understanding of how letters are formed is helpful.

name: Scrolls by Design
description_book: It's tricky to fit all the illumination and text on a scroll, filling the space artfully. Learn some design tips for making the process easier.
description_web: It's tricky to fit all the illumination and text on a scroll, filling the space artfully and without having everything crammed in or leaving big holes and gaps to detract from the balance of the whole document. Learn some design tips for making the process easier while making sure that all the requirements for a presentable scroll are included. Will explore manual methods as well as exploring "cyberscribing" techniques.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

instructor: Lady Elenor dela Rochelle alias Ela
name: *Hwaet saegst thu?* An Introduction to Old English
description_book: Learn skills for translating the language of the Anglo-Saxons. Grammar, pronunciation, resources, and some literature will be covered.
description_web: Old English was the language of the Anglo-Saxons, spoken and written from roughly the 5th century through the 11th century. We will cover basic grammar, pronunciation, and resources for translating Old English. We will also discuss the importance of poetry in reading and understanding Old English. Sources will primarily be from period, with some modern sources and phrases useful for the SCA.

name: Lampworking: Making SCA Order Medallions
description_book: Demo: how to make glass beads and pendants for Society and Kingdom (East) level awards. Brainstorm strategies for making other Order pendants.
description_web: This class will be a demonstration of how to make glass beads and pendants for Society and Kingdom (East) level awards. After a few demonstrations, attendees are invited to bring pictures of other awards they might wish to create themselves, and the class will brainstorm strategies for making those other designs as time allows. I have made Laurel and Pelican medallions, and pendants for East Kingdom awards such as the order of Maunche, Silver Crescent, and OGR, among others. Please note this class is a demonstration only. It is not hands-on. However, the instructor is happy to find a time/place to work one-on-one with interested students at another time during Pennsic.

name: Block Carving
description_book: [TeenU Age 13+] Students who choose to carve will be given a 3"x 4" piece of carving material. Students may bring design. Sharp tools; 5 person limit.
description_web: [TeenU Age 13+] Students who choose to carve will be given a 3"x 4" piece of carving material. Students will be given design options; you may bring your own design (devices, etc., are popular), but should be sure to reverse the design (mirror image) if the direction of the design matters. An example may be if a bird faces left on one's device, one should print the image with the bird facing right.

name: Equity and Inclusion 101: DEI in the SCA
description_book: Learn the terminology of applied courtesy, build skills to promote SCA Core Values, and practice interrupting bias to ensure chivalric virtue!
description_web: Learn the terminology of applied courtesy, build skills to promote SCA Core Values, and practice interrupting bias to ensure chivalric virtue in our organization.

name: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater: Open Adult Rehearsal
description_book: Join a low-stress theatre experience by KWP Readers' Theatre, creating a staged reading of the script *Jane the Doomed Queen*
description_web: Known World Players Readers' Theatre provides a low-stress opportunity and theater experience creating a staged reading of the script *Jane the Doomed Queen*,  by THL Jolicia atte Northclyfe. A staged reading is a performance where the actors perform with the script in their hand and there are no props, costumes, scenery, or special lighting. No audition is necessary; attend both rehearsals. To be performed on Friday 8/2 in the Performing Arts Tent at 7 pm. Sponsored by Known World Players.

name: Ships in the SCA Period: A Chronological Overview
description_book: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.
description_web: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.

name: A Newcomer's Guide to 7th-Century Britain
description_book: Interactive course on the Northumbrian Golden Age: a resurgence of education and culture in Britain's Dark Ages and the battles fought.
description_web: The 7th century was a bleak period of turmoil all across Britain, buried deep in a time now known as "The Dark Ages", but the Kingdom of Northumbria was a beacon shining through the darkness during this period. Learn about the powerful Kings of Bernicia who helped shape England into what it is today and their many battles against the Mercians and Welsh. We'll talk about the creation of Lindisfarne Monastery, the gospels created there, how Celtic Christianity made its way to northeastern England. There will be a diorama featuring art, books and memorabilia from this period. I will also have a painted giant map of the British Isles during this period. There will be an interactive period after my lecture where I will let people take a closer look at everything over snacks and refreshments.

name: Pre-16th-Century Musical Modal Improvisation
description_book: This is a practical application class for musicians to learn improvisational skills that were practiced in the Middle Ages.
description_web: Musician class for acoustic instruments to learn medieval modal improvisation that will teach the student to create melodies on the spot for both free form and structured rhythmic forms. Students are required to be very familiar with their instruments. Reading music is not required but really helps, especially your major and natural minor scales.

name: Beginner's Footwork for English Country Dance
description_book: Starting off on the correct foot allows the figures to flow more easily in English Country Dance. Brand-new beginners to intermediate level.

name: Basic Silk Painting Fun!
description_book: We'll learn the basics of silk painting. Work with silk hoops with exciting images and water color paints!
description_web: Here in this class, we'll learn the basics of silk painting where we will be working with silk hoops with exciting images and water color paints! Everyone is welcome and supplies will be provided so the fun of painting can start right away!

name: Youth Combat Afternoon Session
description_book: Afternoon youth heavy list combat games and battlefield scenarios.
description_web: Afternoon youth heavy list combat games and battlefield scenarios.

name: Left-Handed Calligraphy
description_book: A hands-on introduction to the tools, techniques, and challenges for any left-handed calligrapher. Materials provided.

name: Getting to Know Chaucer's General Prologue
description_book: Learn why this description of a bunch of folks on their way to Canterbury is both cutting social satire and pretty darn funny.
description_web:
Learn why this description of a bunch of folks on their way to Canterbury is both cutting social satire and pretty darn funny. We'll discuss cultural contexts and vocational stereotypes of Chaucer's era as a way of getting into the humor and the substance of this opening portion of Chaucer's poem. I'll have copies of the general prologue available, but students should ideally have read it before the beginning of class.  

An electronic copy is available in interlinear translation here:  https://sites.fas.harvard.edu/~chaucer/teachslf/gp-par.htm

name: Tarot for Teens
description_book: Basic intro to Tarot cards. Participants will learn how to begin using them for readings. Bring your own cards, or borrow ours!
