description_book: I have written stories with a medieval background. They are suitable for ages 10 and above.
description_web: I have written stories with a medieval background. They are suitable for ages 10 and above. I wanted to share them with people who like the medieval period as much as I do.

name: Beginning Netting
description_book: Create that final piece of 14th-century bling, a netted hairnet. Learn how to cast on a circular net, use a gauge stick, and tie the netting knot.
description_web: Create that final piece of 14th-century bling, a netted hairnet. I'll teach how to cast on a circular net, use a gauge stick, and tie the netting knot. Netting can be scaled down to make hairnets of silk, or scaled up to make fish nets or tote bags using a sheet bend knot.
fee_itemization: The material fee covers the cost of the prewound netting shuttle, the gauge stick, and the base rod.

name: The Song of Breath: Troubadour Poetry and Lore
description_book: A survey of the history, beliefs, and lore of the troubadours; special focus on several verse forms, with composition practice. *Sestinas*, anyone?
description_web: A survey of the history, beliefs, and lore of the troubadours; special focus on several verse forms, with composition practice. *Sestinas*, anyone?

name: Making a Glastonbury "Lite" Chair
description_book: Learn the tips and techniques behind a folding chair with Glastonbury-style arms. CD may be available.
description_web: Tired of the look and limited life span of Coleman chairs? Learn the tips and techniques you need to make a wooden folding chair with Glastonbury-style arms. It folds to 6" thick, holds up to 300 lbs, (my wife and I tested it), and can be decorated. CD may be available.

instructor: Mistress Beatriz Aluares de la Oya
name: Introduction to Historical Research
description_book: Taught by a professional research librarian, this class will cover how to conduct historical research with traditional and digital sources.
description_web: Taught by a professional research librarian, this class will cover how to conduct historical research with traditional and digital sources. We will also discuss how to evaluate sources, and the various pitfalls and traps that await the unwary researcher.

name: Pennsic Archery Marshals' meeting
description_book: All target archery marshals must attend one of the marshals' meetings.

name: Melodic Music Realizations on *Basse Danse* Tenors
description_book: Melodic Realizations is a lecture and applied class on the methods of writing melodic divisions above a 15th-century *basse danse* tenor line.
description_web: Melodic Realizations is a lecture and applied class on the methods of writing melodic divisions above a 15th-century *basse danse* tenor line. A solid knowledge of basic theory is required. Bring instruments as we will play some of the monstrosities we come up with.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 on Ankara)
name: Courtesans and the Performing Arts
description_book: The role that courtesans and other sex workers have played in the development of the performing arts throughout the world. **Age 18+**.
description_web: All over the world, the history and development of the performing arts has been intimately tied to sex work. This class will explore the role that courtesans and other sex workers have played as both performers and patrons, and the ways in which they helped mold visual, musical, and dramatic aesthetics in their home nations. We will discuss courtesans from many different times and places, including *hetaerae* (Greece), *devadasis* and *rajadasis* (India), *oiran* (Japan), Safavid Persian courtesans, and Italian courtesans. Sayyida Laila al-Sanna' al-Andalusiyya' is the current East Kingdom Queen's Bard, and the former Bard of Caid. She has a Master's degree in theatre, and has taught voice, acting, theatre history, and dramatic analysis at a university level and in the SCA. **Age 18+**.
fee_itemization: Full color handouts. Fee covers paper and ink.

name: Beginner Dance: English Measures
description_book: A suite of dances for beginners: the basic dance syllabus of later Elizabethan England. This class also serves as practice for the English Revel.
description_web: A suite of dances for beginners: the basic dance syllabus for the gentry of later Elizabethan England. This class also serves as practice for the solemn English Revel.

name: Paint Your Own Scroll
description_book: Children (and their adults) are welcome paint a scroll to take home with them. Please dress appropriately for painting or bring a smock.
description_web: Children (and their adults) are welcome paint a scroll to take home with them. Paint one of our medieval manuscript examples, trace period shapes, or draw your own. Please dress appropriately for painting or bring a smock. All supplies will be provided.

name: Chess on Different Boards
description_book: Chess had several variations during its history, including round and rectangular boards.
description_web: Chess had several variations during its history, including round and rectangular boards. We'll discuss Byzantine chess (circular board), oblong chess (16x4 board), and courier chess (12x8 with extra pieces).

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work. Students will create a wax seal.
description_web: Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work. Students will create a wax seal.

name: Vocal Techniques for Singers and Storytellers
description_book: Give your voice greater strength, better control, expanded range and color, and more energy. Tips and tricks to improve your voice! Youths and adults.
description_web: Give your voice greater strength, better control, expanded range and color, and more energy. Tips and tricks to improve your voice! Youths and adults encouraged.
fee_itemization: $1.00 contribution to keep the handout will be greatfuly accepted, but not required

name: Loom-Woven Pouch
description_book: Create a tabby-woven pouch on a one-piece loom. Class limited to 10 looms.

name: Learning to Draw French Vines
description_book: Learn to draw (and time permitting, paint) French vine illumination.
description_web: Learn to draw (and time permitting, paint) French vine illumination. We will cover styles, techniques and short cuts to recreating the dancing leaves of French borders. Primarily a drawing class, but we will get into painting techniques if the class time allows.

name: Morgan Bible *Book Of Kings* Scribal Workshop
description_book: An advanced four-day workshop focusing on the painting techniques and materials used to create this glorious medieval manuscript.
description_web: An advanced five-day workshop focusing on the painting techniques and materials used to create this glorious medieval manuscript. Areas of instruction to include, but are not limited to, the following: gilding, anatomy, shading clothing, white-work, pen work and calligraphy.
fee_itemization: 23K gold, raised gilding gesso, paint, palette, ink, quill tip pen, caligraphy pen, exercise cards/practice sheets and an 11x14 scroll blank.

name: Telling Stories as Your Persona
description_book: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.
description_web: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.

name: Beginning Knitting
description_book: Learn to knit and make a simple pouch. Needles and yarn provided, or bring your favorite color of worsted weight yarn.

name: The Viking Sunstone
description_book: Scientific discussion about the Viking sunstone and how scholars speculate it was used for navigation.

name: Death of an Amazon: A 15th-Century Sword Dance
description_book: My own 15th-century-style choreography depicting the battle between Penthesilea and Achilles. An action-packed performance!
description_web: My own 15th-century-style choreography depicting the battle between Penthesilea and Achilles. An action-packed performance!

name: Siege Inspections
description_book: Pre-battle inspections for all siege equipment to be used on the battlefield during Pennsic.
description_web: Pre-battle inspections for all siege equipment to be used on the battlefield during Pennsic.

name: *Sgraffito, Pastiglia*, Tooling: Gilded Wood
description_book: Gold was decorated with elaborate designs: *pastiglia* (raised gesso), *sgraffito*, tooling, punching. Part 2: **Tuesday**, August 6, 11 am-1 pm.
description_web: Gilded wood panels for paintings, altarpieces, frames and furniture were decorated with elaborate patterns. *Pastiglia* (raised gesso), *sgraffito* (drawing into tempera on gold), tooling and punching (indenting gold with metal tools), plus spinning on gold, all create dramatic effects by refracting light in all directions, making gold look like fabric, and halos spin. Learn the complex and beautiful ways gold was used to glorify. This is a two-part class. Part 2 is on **Tuesday**, August 6, 11 am-1 pm.
fee_itemization: gold leaf, tools, clay and glue, sample panels

name: Singing and Playing Unbarred Music
description_book: SCA period music was generally written without measure lines. Sing or play (C or F instruments) 4-part music.
description_web: SCA period music was generally written without measure lines. Fully embrace period music! Come sing (most are vocal pieces) or play (any C or F instruments) in four parts with THL Siri. Knowledge of standard notation and rhythmic values necessary. Teen-friendly class!

name: The Pennsic Mightier: Improv Comedy Show
description_book: The Pennsic is mightier than the sword.
description_web: The Pennsic is mightier than the sword and anything can happen! Enjoy a fun night of long-form improvised comedy based on your suggestions and stories presented by the Pennsic Mightier Workshop cast!

name: Yoga for Relaxation and Recovery
description_book: Gentle yoga practice offered before dinner, M, W, F in Atlantian Royal. Bring your mat and dress to flex. Low and slow practice for Pennsic pain.
description_web: A gentle yoga practice offered for those who aren't up early and prefer a before-dinner option. Repeating dates under the big tent in Atlantian Royal encampment, facilitated by a combination of teachers. Bring your yoga mat and wear comfortable clothing that allows flexibility. M, W, F Peace and War Week. This is a low and slow practice targeting everything that hurts from Pennsic setup, walking, and activities.

name: The Way of Saint James: Pilgrims to Santiago
description_book: We examine the legends, history, battles, miracles, and lore of Spain's *Camino de Santiago*, in period and today, taught by former pilgrims.
description_web: We will examine the legends, history, and lore of the *Camino de Santiago*, with special emphasis on the nature of medieval pilgrimage, sites of special historic, religious, and cultural importance along the route, plus advice for planning and completing the pilgrimage today. Taught by former pilgrims. *¡Buen camino!*

name: Ghosts in Period
description_book: People have always seen ghosts. How was the way they experienced them different from today and in other times?
description_web: People have always seen ghosts, but they interpreted what they saw through cultural filters. So, medieval ghost stories, late classical ghost stories, Renaissance ghost stories are all slightly different from modern ghost stories. We'll be looking at various period stories and explanations for what people thought they experienced. Mostly European.

name: Medallion Cord Make-and-Take
description_book: Look spiffy with a medallion cord you made yourself by fingerloop braiding.
description_web: Look spiffy with a medallion cord you made yourself by fingerloop braiding. This is an easy-to-learn technique to create handsome strong cord in any combination of colors.

name: Suck it Up: The History of Cupping
description_book: Learn about the history of ancient Chinese cupping: when it was developed, different types of cupping, how it was done and why people did it.
description_web: This class will teach you the history of ancient Chinese cupping from its beginnings using animal horns to more sophisticated bamboo and glass cups. Learn how different types of cupping were done and what each was used for. The class will include a brief demonstration of fire cupping.

name: Iron *Commedia*: World Premiere
description_book: Earlier this same day, a group of foolish players came together to craft, cast, and create a brand-new "16th-century" *commedia dell'arte* play!
description_web: Earlier this same day, a group of foolish players came together to craft, cast, and create a brand new sixteenth-century *commedia dell'arte* play to premiere before your very eyes! Sorry, we can't give you a plot synopsis because we only just built the plot a few hours before the performance! Come see the zany foolishness in extremely live theatre! (And don't miss when we do it again on War Week Thursday!) *Probably family-friendly but possibly some material inappropriate for very young children, but it's unknown until the play is crafted at the workshop earlier that day.*

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Class limited to 10 looms.

name: Youth Combat Evening Activities
description_book: An evening to hone youth combat skills with a more fluid structure to the session.
description_web: An evening to hone youth combat skills with a more fluid structure to the session.

name: Songs from Around the World
description_book: Period and folk music in a multitude of languages.
description_web: Bards and music lovers band together to perform songs, both period and traditional, from around the world and across countries.

name: *Chorale du Lac* (Bog Choir)
description_book: Choir class for all levels of singers, no experience necessary; all voices welcome. Simple period part-songs, rounds, catches.
description_web:
We will warm up, discuss and practice new vocal, music theory, and choral skills each day. Then we'll sing a selection of rounds, catches, and simple part-songs from period sources. Each day will be a different class. This is a good choir class for beginning singers who want to sing together in a group for fun, as well as for experienced singers to take a refresher in choral singing and work on technique and tuning. No experience necessary; all voices welcome. Instead of rehearsing for a performance, we will practice for learning's sake and go caroling in the Bog at the end of the series. 
Visit https://www.facebook.com/groups/1470354713287848/, the "Bog University" FaceBook group for more info.

name: KWP Youth Readers' Theater
description_book: KWP Pennsic Youth Readers' Theater will perform a staged reading of *The Goose Girl* by Gary L. Blackwood.
description_web: Pennsic Youth Readers' Theatre will perform *The Goose Girl* by Gary L. Blackwood. This will be a script-in-hand performance by the youth of Pennsic, ages 8-14. This type of performance does not have costumes, sets, or lighting. Sponsored by the Known World Players. Open to all performers 8-14; see class listings for rehearsal details.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; children must have adult escort.

name: Teen/'Tween Lounge: Game Night
description_book: Bring your period and modern games and play in our lighted tent with other teens and 'tweens. Ages 10-17 are welcome. Some games will be provided.
description_web: Bring your period and modern games and play in our lighted tent with other teens and 'tweens. Ages 10-17 are welcome. Some games will be provided.

name: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater
description_book: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater presents staged reading of  *Jane the Doomed Queen*.
description_web: This is a staged reading of the script *Jane the Doomed Queen*, written by THL Jolicia atte Northclyfe. A staged reading is a performance where the actors perform with the script in their hand and there are no props, costumes, scenery, or special lighting. Sponsored by Known World Players. See class listings for rehearsal details. **Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.**

name: Period Jewelry: A Slide Show
description_book: Slides of jewels from museums, ranging from migration period through Renaissance.
description_web: Slides of jewels from museums, ranging from migration period through Renaissance.

name: Night Sky Over Pennsic
description_book: Family-friendly viewing of the night sky over Pennsic. Bring a camp chair or blanket if desired. A small telescope will be set up for viewing.
description_web:
Family-friendly viewing of the night sky over Pennsic. Bring a camp chair or blanket if desired. A small telescope will be set up for viewing.
As the battlefield is parking during the first week, the open area in front of Pennsic University Point will be used.

name: English Revels
description_book: Come one and all to the solemn revel and post-revel (and a little banquet, too) at which we shall dance the *Old Measures* and other English dances.
description_web: Come one and all to the solemn revel and post-revel (and a little banquet, too) at which we shall dance the *Old Measures* and other English dances. For those who do not know all of the *Old Measures*, printed memoranda shall be available.

name: Drunk and Disorderly
description_book: Period Songs with a Splash Zone.
description_web: Gather round to hear as raucous Celtic folk band "Drunk and Disorderly" regales you with songs of drinking, roving, fighting, and things to keep secret from your mother. Plus songs in over 40 different languages! We perform anything from Latin drinking songs to French bawdy madrigals to Japanese sea shanties. You will laugh, cry, blush, and wonder where you left the whiskey! Pick a language!  **Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.**

location: Chirurgeons' Point (Corner of St. Lawrence Way and Brewer's Rd.)
name: 7th Annual Unofficial Pennsic Half-Marathon
description_book: The half-marathon is an approximately 13.1-mile run around the Pennsic campground, open to all interested runners or walkers.
description_web: The estimated 13-mile course (it is medievally inexact!) will consist of three loops around the entire Pennsic campground, plus one smaller loop around the Serengeti. Runners will meet in front of Chirurgeons' Point at 7 a.m. Water is available from the chirurgeons, but runners are encouraged to supply their own water/sports drink/snack needs. We will pass the Chirurgeons' Point three times, at roughly 4.5-mile intervals. Note: This is a group run, not a race. No times will be kept, though there will be some participant awards. The goal is fitness as part of the SCAdian lifestyle. All are welcome, and participants may join for as much or as little distance as desired. Wearing medieval-style tunics and presenting as medieval an appearance as is practicable is encouraged.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of War--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of War--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: 12-step recovery meeting. This is an open meeting for those involved in a 12-step program. It is run on an agnostic format.
description_web: 12-step recovery meeting. This is an open meeting for those involved in a 12-step program. It is run on an agnostic format.

location: Thunder Bird Atlatl  (Thunder Bird Atlatl Booth #101?)
name: How to Make an *Atlatl* Dart
description_book: How to make an *atlatl* dart from start to cast. Limit of four students in each class. Cost of kits ranges from $30-$50, or $8 per dart.
description_web: How to make an *atlatl* dart from start to cast. Limit of four students in each class. Kits: Basic Caster and 3 dart available from Thunderbird Atlatl for $50 or Caster $30 and/or $8 per Dart 5' or 6'.
fee_itemization: Kits: Basic Caster and 3 dart available from Thunderbird Atlatl for $50 or Caster $30 and/or $8 per Dart 5' or 6'.

name: Morning Session, Youth Combat Open Field
description_book: Morning drills and skills session for youth heavy list fighters. Castle Battle may pre-empt one morning. Check in with YC for details.
description_web: Morning drills and skills session for youth heavy list fighters. Castle Battle may pre-empt one morning. Check in with YC for details.

name: Pick-up Techniques for Inkle Bands
description_book: Experienced weavers learn how to manipulate the warp on an inkle band to create more advanced patterns.
description_web: You're already comfortable weaving a plain band on an inkle loom, and you're ready for the next step. Using a pre-warped loom, you'll learn how to read a basic pick-up pattern, and move both heddled and unheddled threads into a different shed.

name: Battle of Pavia, 1525
description_book: A look at the pivotal 1525 battle of Pavia during the Italian Wars.
description_web: A look at the pivotal 1525 battle of Pavia during the Italian Wars. The class will look at the events leading up to the battle, the key people, the battle itself, and the outcome.

name: Basic Hand Sewing
description_book: Learn period methods of seaming and hemming, fabric traits, and how to reduce thread wear and tangling. Fabric, thread, needles supplied.
description_web: Learn period methods of seaming and hemming, fabric traits, and how to reduce thread wear and tangling. Fabric, thread, and needles will be supplied. Please bring needles and scissors if you have them. This course is appropriate for adults and for children the parents consider old enough to handle the needles safely.
fee_itemization:
5 pages @ .10 page
materials include fabric, needles, and thread

name: Creation of the Venetian *Carnevale* Mask
description_book: Hands-on class on the creation of the simple Venetian *Carnevale* masks worn in period.
description_web: We will be creating Venetian *Carnevale* masks from molds based on period masks created ahead of time by the instructor. Due to limited materials, only 5 students will be able to go home with a mask from the class.
fee_itemization: Cost of specialized paper for mask making

name: Lucet: Beyond Square Cord
description_book: You can make good square cord; what's next? Flat and multi-strand cords. Bring your lucet. (We can slip a cord off and put it back on after class.)
description_web: You’re comfortable making square cord; what's next? We'll work on flat and multi-strand cord variations. Please bring your lucet. We'll also demonstrate how to slip a cord off and put it back on after class.
fee_itemization: (4) colors of floss on bobbins, and handout.

name: The Bayeux Tapestry and the Battle of Hastings
description_book: History is embroidered by the victors! An introduction to the story in the Bayeux Tapestry and the events leading up to the Battle of Hastings.

name: The Market Wallet: A Form of Period Luggage
description_book: The market wallet is an alternative to the shoulder bag in use from Anglo-Saxon to 19th-C Europe. Construction and period evidence will be discussed.
description_web: The market wallet is an alternative to the shoulder bag in use from Anglo-Saxon to 19th-century Europe. Construction and period evidence will be discussed.

name: Drill, Hammer, Repeat: Rivet with Nail Set Tool
description_book: Hands-on class. Introduction to riveting together metals, or metals and leather, by using a nail set tool and pre-made rivets or escutcheon pins.
description_web: In this hands-on class, you will be introduced to a different technique of riveting together metals (copper, various brasses, bronze, fine silver, sterling silver, etc.), or metals and leather, by using a nail set tool and pre-made rivets or escutcheon pins. **Note:** Bring ear plugs if you are sensitive to loud noises.
fee_itemization: There are 7 sets of tools, and 14 kits of materials, for a maximum of 14 students to work hands-on, sets of tools will be shared between 2 students.

name: 14th-Century Birgitta-Type Cap
description_book: Get started on making a simple cap similar to the St. Birgitta cap. Stitches will be taught.
description_web: Make a simple cap similar to the St. Birgitta cap, appropriate for 14th-century women. The class will focus on making the cap, though history and use of the cap will be briefly discussed.
fee_itemization: Fee covers the linen, and the linen thread.

name: Holy Cows and Flaming Monks
description_book: True to form, the SCA has produced its own folk saints, and what may start as an inside joke ends up looking like a real saint's cult.
description_web: Like the Middle Ages itself, the SCA has produced its own folk saints, and what may start as an inside joke ends up looking like a real saint's cult. We'll explore some of the weirder saints to come out of the SCA, and look at the cult of St. Bunstable as a case study.

name: Modern Media & the SCA: Making Them Work Together
description_book: How to connect with modern media to share the SCA on a larger scale and provide a good story for the news.
description_web: Reaching people who are interested in the SCA can be difficult; reaching a large number at once even more so. In this class, Æthelmearc Media Liaison and broadcast journalist THL Arias Beltran del Valle discusses how to reach out to modern media and share activities and events with them, while also adhering to Society media policies. Includes what to do (and not to do!) when the media arrives at an event. Included in the discussion will be suggestions on how to make an event more interesting to news outlets. We'll touch on rights given to the reporters and to participants. We'll also discuss who should be involved in preparations for meeting the media at an event, and how to present the best face for your group!

name: Intermediate Irish Language for SCAdians
description_book: Conversational Irish based on SCA scenarios.
description_web: Already speak *a cupla focal* (a few words) in Irish? Or have you attended the Beginning Irish Language class? Brush up your basics and keep the momentum going. Learn more SCA-related phrases to start conversations, and some Irish blessings and curses.

name: Empty Tent Place Holder - 2 Hours
description_book: Keeps a tent open next to a loud class.

instructor: Lady Adaire Wren of Owl's Nest
name: Thrifting for Beginners
description_book: Outfitting new SCAdians through recycle shopping, ideas from garb to decor.

name: Atlantian St Sebastian's Shoot
description_book: A novelty archery shoot for the masses. This is the 10th and final annual Pennsic shoot that will be held at the Archery Range.
description_web: A novelty archery shoot for the masses. This is the 10th and final annual Pennsic shoot that will be held at the Archery Range.

name: Care and Maintenance of Sewing Machines
description_book: A sewing machine is designed to last twenty to eighty years. Why they don't, how they can, and figuring out a machine you've never seen before.

name: *Adventure Maximus*: An Introductory D&D-style RPG
description_book: *Adventure Maximus* is a D&D-style game for young players, with simple character sheets and a basic dungeon crawl. Limited to no more than 8 players.

name: Rapier Battle of La Rochelle
description_book: The defenders of La Rochelle **will** die! The only question is **when**? Join us at the Fort to find out. Heavy rapier and rubber band gun melée.
description_web: The defenders of La Rochelle **will** die! The only question is **when**? Join us at the Fort to find out. Heavy rapier and rubber band gun melée. Attackers will have unlimited resurrections, defenders will have limited resurrections. RBG cannon are welcome. No archery, please. Pennsic standard rules for rapier apply. Don't have a heavy rapier? Bring a dagger or two. Bring a friend or 20. The more the merrier. Don't like to fight melée? Come and get close to the action and help marshal the battle. Please muster **at the Fort**  half an hour before the start time, especially if you want to fight with a particular group.

name: Period Card Games: *Losing Loadem*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period, trick-avoidance card game.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game based on a reconstruction from Francis Willughby’s *A Volume of Plaies* (~1665).

name: SCA Steel Fighting Experiment
description_book: SCA-sanctioned experiment to evaluate bringing steel fighting into the Society. There will be demos and fighting practice for interested parties.
description_web: SCA-sanctioned experiment to evaluate bringing steel fighting into the Society. There will be demos of fighting, armor and weapons, as well as practice. Single combat only. Non-SCA Steel fighters are welcome. For more information contact Duke Michael of Bedford. Strawberry Fields B6. bolt_ml@yahoo.com.

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a small strap or trim piece.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Class limited to 5 looms. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

name: *La Verdadera Destreza*: Spanish Fencing Research
description_book: Learn about the period and modern writers of this Spanish fencing style and the primary elements that define it. Lecture class.
description_web: Learn about the period and modern writers of this Spanish fencing style and the primary elements that define it. Lecture class.

name: Ædult Swim at Pennsic
description_book: Duke Timothy of Arindale and Master Illadore de Bedegrayne will be holding the field along with many members of the Chivalry and Defense.
description_web:
Once again, Duke Timothy of Arindale and Master Illadore de Bedegrayne will be holding the field along with many members of the Chivalry and Defense of the Knowne World.

Did you miss ÆSwim in February? Well, now's your chance to do it in August.

Show us your skill at arms and the fire in your belly. Renown is earned by deeds.
We will train you. We will spar with you. We will, if you desire, bring our "A" game.
No excuses.
"They don't notice me." Make us.
"They never come to my shire." Here we are.
"I'm out of practice." Here's where to get some. 
"They don't fight my form." We'll match weapon forms if you like.

In Service,
Timothy and Illadore

name: Period Pigments
description_book: A discussion about period pigments and their use. Students will make their own *gouache* and take home a paint palette and handout.
description_web: A discussion about period pigments and their use. Students will make their own *gouache* using gum arabic and natural pigments. All material will be provided and students making *gouache* will be required to wear a face mask, which will be provided, in order to take part. Students will take home a paint palette and handout.

name: Sack of Rome, 1527
description_book: An overview of the 1527 sack of Rome by Spanish, German, and Italian troops. Includes its lead-up, campaign, and results.
description_web: An overview of the 1527 Sack of Rome by Spanish, German, and Italian troops of the Holy Roman Empire. The class will look at the political and military events leading up to the sack, the campaign itself, and the political results.

name: Guild of Saint Barbara Annual Meeting
description_book: Annual meeting will cover safety, new items, and also go over the firing schedule. As always, please bring questions.
description_web:
The Guild of Saint Barbara will having its annual meeting on Middle Saturday at 10 am. The meeting will cover safety, new items, and also go over the firing schedule for Pennsic 48. Please join us for this informative session and feel free to bring questions. 
There will be a break between the meeting and training. Please **DO NOT** bring powder to Pennsic!

name: Pennsic Without a Cooler
description_book: How to feed yourself period food at long camping events without the use of a cooler.

name: Nefarious Characters, Like Assassins and Such
description_book: How assassins existed in the past; other bits of information regarding assassins and other nefarious types.

name: Arabic 101: Conversation and Pronunciation
description_book: Learn to pronounce Arabic names and practice using Arabic in your SCA life. Useful for many personas - strong emphasis on *Maghrebi* dialect .
description_web: Learn the correct pronunciation of Arabic names and phrases. Add a linguistic flair to your persona by integrating Arabic words and phrases (like *hafla*) into your SCA conversations. While useful for personas from many regions, the dialect and vocabulary will focus on the *Maghreb* region.

name: Knitting Frustrations: Help Is Here!
description_book: Bring your knitting challenges and I will help you overcome them.
description_web: Bring your knitting challenges and I will help you overcome them. Handout of solutions to common challenges will be available.

name: Heraldry 101: Pageantry, Authenticity, Identity
description_book: Newcomers will learn the jobs and services of a herald in court, approving arms and names, and announcements.
description_web: Do you want to register a beautiful coat of arms to display on your banner? Do you wonder how court happens behind the scenes? And who are those people that yell out announcements when you’re trying to sleep in? This brief overview will help you understand how heraldry contributes to the medieval ambiance of the Society and the duties of the Office of Herald. We will discuss the organization of heraldic activities, major divisions in heraldic effort, how heraldry gives structure in a court setting, and provide a chance to answer your questions.

location: Courtesan College (Strawberry Fields B06 on Ankara)
name: 16th-Century Western Erotica
description_book: An exploration of the *I Modi* and other erotic works of the 16th century. **Age 18+.**
description_web: *I Modi* (*The Ways*), also known as *The Sixteen Pleasures*, is a famous erotic book of the Italian Renaissance in which a series of sexual positions were explicitly depicted in engravings. We will examine images from this work and others that explore sexual art for its own sake. There are handouts available. Because of the nature of the class, **age 18+** only.

name: Making Monsters
description_book: Children over five will sculpt gargoyle monsters using self-hardening clay. Skills taught will be adapted to differing abilities of those attending.
description_web: Children over five will sculpt gargoyle style monsters using self-hardening clay. Skills taught will be adapted to differing abilities of those attending.

name: Embossing Metal, a Simplified Kind of *Repoussé*
description_book: (YouthU Ages 13-17) We will do a simplified version of *repoussé*, which is pushing out a picture in a piece of metal.
description_web: (YouthU Ages) Using metal foil and wooden tools, we will make a picture by embossing a picture in the metal. This class is geared for kids/teens. When we are done we will patina the metal to show contrast.
fee_itemization: 2 pieces of metal foil to emboss,  use of tools, and supplies

location: Herald's Point ( Intersection of the Low Road with the Great Eastern Highway, next to Family Point)
name: Topics in Basic Heraldry
description_book: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory skills for consulting at Pennsic Herald's Point. Dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point.
description_web: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory submission skills necessary to consult at Pennsic Herald's Point. Exact dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point at the beginning of the War. All newer heralds are strongly encouraged to attend at least one of these classes prior to volunteering at Herald's Point.

name: Japanese Stab Book Binding
description_book: Assemble your own book with Japanese stab book binding. Learn this simple but elegant book binding style in an hour.
description_web: Assemble your own book with Japanese stab book binding. Learn this simple but elegant book binding style in an hour.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this seven-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may view a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair. Student Performance, date, time, and location will be announced.

name: Pennsic Known World Choir
description_book: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested, adult singers! This year's concert theme is "Songs of Food and Drink."
description_web: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested, adult singers! This year's concert theme is "Songs of Food and Drink." The repertoire includes pieces by Palestrina, Lassus, Ravenscroft, Bateson and others. Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on Thursday evening of War Week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is helpful, but not required if you learn the music in advance. Sheet music and audio tracks are available online at https://bit.ly/2TQZuoy. Pre-registration is requested although not required (on the Pennsic War web site). Please bring a 1" or ½” black folder for your music and a pencil.
fee_itemization: Limited extra music is available for $3 per set.

name: Viking Navigation and the Sunstone
description_book: Early navigation methods up through Viking times. What the History Channel's 'Vikings' series think they got right - sort of.
description_web: The methods of navigation employed by the Viking navigators are being verified by archaeological evidence. The class will present early navigational aids based on discussions with two of the experts in this field: Soren Thirslund's research on the "Viking Compass" at the Danish National Maritime Museum, and Leif Karlsen's "Secrets of the Viking Navigators" and our own research. The published works of Thirslund and Karlsen are available from the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde, Denmark. We provide hands-on demonstrations and primary source documentation of these authors’ navigation theories.

name: Beaded Flowers 3: Primrose
description_book: Make a primrose in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nosed pliers/wire cutters, please bring them to class.
description_web: Make a primrose in the style of beaded flowers of 16th-century Venice. If you have needle-nosed pliers/wire cutters, please bring them to class. Not recommended for youth. Take the Rose class first; this is a more advanced technique.

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn axe throwing, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have multiple teachers, so if you attend more than one walk you will likely learn different things!

name: *Mehteran*: Ottoman Janissary Band
description_book: The *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* studies music and history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band of the 14th-17th c. for performance at Pennsic.
description_web: The *Osmanlı Mehter Takımı* (Ottoman Janissary Band) studies music and history of the Ottoman *Mehter* military marching band from the 14th-17th century. The *Mehteran* will learn the historic Ottoman songs, *Ceddin Deden*, *Osman Pasa*, and *Ahmed Nesim-i* and  played on *zurna, davul*, horns, cymbals, and kettledrums, and sung by a choir, and will learn the historic Janissary march for performance at Pennsic. Brass horn players, percussionists and singers are welcome and encouraged to participate. Further details on the *Mehteran* Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/134233213955988/

name: It Begins with a Box and an X
description_book: A beginner illumination class. It will help build basic skills and confidence.
description_web: This is a beginner-level scribal class. Learn to recreate a very simple illumination element. You will acquire basic skills in brushwork and color mixing. It is a hands-on event.

name: Bling Out Your Veils
description_book: Basic veil beading. You will leave class with a working knowledge of how to do simple veil beading. All supplies and veil will be supplied.
description_web: Basic veil beading. You will leave class with a working knowledge of how to do simple veil beading. Ten kits available. Other students may watch the class; there will be extra handouts. If you would like to attend, you can bring your own veil and beads, and take the class.
fee_itemization:
fabric for veil
beads
beading needle
thread

name: Make a Pair of Wax Tablets
description_book: Make a pair of wax tablets with hand-woodworking tools.

name: *Ars Dictaminis*: Art of Medieval Letter Writing
description_book: Learn letter writing, medieval style! Using period sources, we'll look at how and what letters were used for, plus how to write your own!
description_web: Letter writing was the primary form of communication in period, but is a neglected art today. Rediscover the beauty and fun of letter-writing from period sources. We'll look at the art of writing a proper letter, famous correspondence, and examples of everyday letters sent by people all across society. Plus, plenty of tips for writing your own letters!

name: 16th-Century Persian Clothing Head to Toe
description_book: Learn what makes Persian clothing...Persian! We will also discuss the differences between Turkish and Persian clothing.
description_web: Confidently learn how to identify Persian clothing from head to toe. We will also explore the differences between Turkish and Persian clothing and the common mistakes in SCA Persian clothing.

name: A Receipt from Paré: A Period Plaster
description_book: Learn about the instructor's experiment in creating a wound plaster (adhesive) as written in Ambroise Parés *Works*.

name: Keeping Bees in the Knowne World
description_book: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.
description_web: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.

name: Papercut Art Around the World
description_book: From *Jianzhi* of China to *Papel Picado* of Latin America, come learn and create beautiful art. All you need is paper, a knife, and an idea!
description_web: Around the world, dozens of countries and cultures created art with paper and a knife. From the beautiful window hangings of early China to the stencils of India, to the lace-like prayer cards of late period Europe, papercut art is seen and done around the world. Come learn one of the most inexpensive but beautiful arts of the SCA! All you need is paper, a knife and an idea (though a cutting mat isn't a bad idea to have too). Patterns from all different styles will be provided to learn from and recreate. Knives, paper, and cutting mats will be available for use during the class only. Come learn a new art and watch your piece come to life as you create as you cut away!

name: Horse 101
description_book: Basic horse knowledge: grooming, haltering, leading and tack training.
description_web: What to know about "The Horse" when you are interested in equestrian activities. This will provide a basic understanding of horse handling, including basic grooming, haltering, leading and tack training. Includes safety procedures and tips for horse handling for all ground crew and volunteers around the equestrian arena. An introduction of different equestrian activities within the SCA will be included within the lecture. This is a great starting point if you are interested in becoming involved in the equestrian program. No horse experience required.

name: Transgender Experience in Medieval Europe
description_book: This class will focus on LGBTQ, queer, and gender/feminist studies in examining the lived experience of transgendered individuals in medieval Europe.
description_web: This class will focus on LGBTQ, queer, and gender/feminist studies in examining the lived experience of transgendered individuals in medieval Europe.

name: Leather Coronets: Light, Bright and Beautiful
description_book: We'll go over some of the options in putting together a leather coronet.
description_web: Does your coronet weigh heavy on your brow....not from duty, but from the amount of metal on your head? Do you want something lighter but still elegant? This class will go over some of the options in putting together a leather coronet.

name: Cannon Advanced Warning System (CAWS)
description_book: Briefing/discussion on Sound Triggered Anxiety and PTSD within the SCA and new Alert System.
description_web: Briefing/discussion on Sound Triggered Anxiety and PTSD within the SCA and the efforts that have been made thus far to provide messaging services and education for sufferers. Class will begin with a briefing on the issues, the service, and how to sign up. The last part of the class will be an open discussion forum relating to the topic, plans for the future, and an exchange of ideas on how best to move forward.

name: Drama Rocks!
description_book: School-age kids are invited to join Lady Scholastica and Lady Silly for some fun theatre games and dramatic creativity!
description_web: School-age kids are invited to join Lady Scholastica (Dean of Performing Arts) and Lady Silly (Pennsic Performing Arts Youth Coordinator) in creative dramatics and theatre games! Get ready to be quiet and **loud**, serious and **silly**!

name: Beginning *Atlatl*
description_book: Learn the basics of *atlatl* safety: how to hold the *atlatl*, load a dart, and throw the dart.
description_web: Learn the basics of *atlatl* safety: how to hold the *atlatl*, load a dart, and throw the dart.

location: Courtesan Collage (Strawberry Fields B06 on Ankara)
name: Menstruation and Fertility in the Middle Ages
description_book: Includes gynecology, obstetrics, and family planning, with an emphasis on women’s agency over their bodies. **18+ only**.
description_web:
*But to Foule Lust and Likynge of Lecherye:* Menstruation, Family Planning, and Women’s Bodily Autonomy

This class explores practices in women’s medicine; specifically gynecology, obstetrics, and family planning; with an emphasis on women’s agency over their bodies. Some of these practices and concepts will be funny, some will be graphic, and some may be disturbing. Content warning: sex, abortion, miscarriage, consent, menstruation, death. **Age 18+**. 
No children permitted. Thank you in advance for your understanding.

name: Dances for Tonight's Early Bird Ball
description_book: Most of the dances will be taught at the Early Bird Ball. Learn the four that will not be taught!
description_web: Learn the four dances that will not be taught at the Early Bird Ball. As of the time of the book being printed we are planning on *Bella Gioiosa, Old Mole*, a *Galliard*, and *Hunting of the Squirrel*. Other dances from the ball will be taught if time permits.

name: Midrealm Shield Maiden Deed
description_book: Face the Midrealm Shield Maidens in a gantlet-style deed. Fight or fence against them and earn up to three tokens.
description_web: Come face the Midrealm Shield Maidens in a gantlet-style deed. The format would be all comers to fight or fence against the shield maidens in a chosen form. (Extra weapons or specific armor will be brought for challengers.) Those that fight through the entire list will receive three tokens. One for Rapier, one for Armored and one for those that do both.

name: Intro to *Xiangqi* (Chinese Chess)
description_book: A class on the basic rules and beginning tactics of the game, with time to play afterwards.
description_web: A class on the basic rules and beginning tactics of the game, with time to play afterwards.

name: Gold Leafing: Period to Modern
description_book: Sample the field of gold leaf methods for both period and modern gilding. Period fish glue, garlic, glair, gesso, permacol for paper and parchment.
description_web: Understand gold leaf methods for illumination through a sample of period and modern glue as well as application. Class will focus on period fish glue, garlic, glair, plus modern gesso, permacol and miniatum for paper and parchment. Learn application tricks for glue, and tips for a perfect finish in both period and modern methods. Bring your gilding questions and problems for troubleshooting and analysis! Create small gilded samplers on parchment, pergamenata, and paper. All materials included.
fee_itemization: gold leaf, glues, paper, parchment, pergamenata, tools

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Po Silvertop's Vigil
description_book: Po will be sent on vigil to contemplate his decision regarding admission to Æthelmearc's Order of Defense.
description_web: Po will be sent on vigil to contemplate his decision regarding admission to Æthelmearc's Order of Defense. He will Play the Prize, facing all challenges on the field of honor, and will sit briefly to hear words of advice. The vigil hours are from 11:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. This time includes set-up and Royal Court.

name: Cooking from Period Sources
description_book: How to start with a recipe that was written in period and end up with a dish that is consistent with that recipe and tastes good.
description_web: How to start with a recipe that was written in period and end up with a dish that is consistent with that recipe and tastes good. Also, a discussion of available sources for recipes.

name: Embroider Your Heraldry!
description_book: Learn two quick and easy stitches for embroidering heraldry: Kloster and long-arm.
description_web: Learn two quick and easy stitches for embroidering heraldry. See examples of long-arm cross stitch and Kloster stitch, and learn both stitches. These are perfect for filling areas of heraldry quickly. Bring embroidery supplies or use mine. There will be free handouts for both stitches.

name: Teen D&D Campaign: Face Red Hand Tribe
description_book: Be a Hero! Save the village of Kove Vale from goblins! Short D&D 3.5 campaign for ages 12-17. Must attend all sessions. No experience necessary.
description_web: Be a Hero! The Red Hand Tribe of Goblins have risen to become a major menace to Cove Vale. A few brave heroes are needed to push them back and make the vale safe for allied races again. Short D&D 3.5 campaign for ages 12-17. Must attend all sessions. No previous experience necessary.

name: Odin and the Case of a Hundred Names
description_book: Soldier, mystic, poet, king. In Norse mythology, Odin bears a hundred names and a hundred faces. But who did the Norse think he was?
description_web: Soldier, mystic, poet, king. In Norse mythology, Odin bears a hundred names and a hundred faces. But who did the Norse think he was?

name: Structure of Elizabethan Tragedy
description_book: Elizabethan tragedy was a high point of dramatic art. But what made a tragedy a tragedy? Discover the elements these great plots have in common.
description_web: Elizabethan tragedy was a high point of dramatic art. But what made a tragedy a tragedy? Come discover the elements these great plays have in common. We will analyze the five-act structure of 16th-century English drama and consider how it relates to the movement of the plots of several plays by Shakespeare and his contemporaries.

name: Irish Bardic Tradition
description_book: The Irish Bardic tradition from pre-Christian times to the Flight of the Earls (1607).
description_web: The Irish Bardic tradition from pre-Christian times to the Flight of the Earls (1607). Details on the Bardic Schools, status and power of bards, ability to curse through "satire," the epics, praise poems, music, and presentation style.

name: Accessibility in the SCA
description_book: Learn how to make your event more accessible to those who are differently abled.
description_web: Learn how to make your event more accessible to those who are differently abled.

name: Make Your Own Medallion Cord
description_book: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, cord-making described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. OK to be late.
description_web: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, a method for cord-making that can best be described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult. *Slung* is also known as Viking whip-cording. It is not only useful but a lot of fun for all ages. Can be done as a children's activity or at demos. Bring a friend! People will be taking turns on a limited number of set-ups. Showing up late is perfectly fine.

name: Pennsic Radio Base-Station Training
description_book: Do you have a voice for radio? We want you! This is the training for running the main radio base-station for the Pennsic Watch.
description_web: Do you have a voice for radio? Yes? Then we want you! This is the training for running the main radio base-station for the Pennsic Watch. Learn the technical aspects of operating a radio dispatch base-station and how the Pennsic communication center functions as well as the protocols we follow that keep us operating within FCC guidelines. This will include hands-on airtime on a secondary channel in the Pennsic radio system. Then, volunteer for a couple of shifts as radio operator. Come have fun while keeping Pennsic organized and safe.

name: A&S Item Photography
description_book: Free documentation photography of your A&S items. This is not a class; it is a time during which I will provide a service to Known World Artisans.
description_web:
Free documentation photography of your A&S items. This is not a class; it is a time during which I will provide a service to Known World Artisans.
Artists will be granted a perpetual license to use the images of their work for noncommercial purposes. (2019 and beyond: Please contact instructor via https://forms.gle/6ptZhTNAHoUWomH88 at least 30 days prior to Pennsic to help me manage my equipment pack list.)

name: The Astrolabe in Theory and Practice
description_book: We'll discuss the history, theory and function of the astrolabe and provide extensive hands-on practical experience using one.
description_web: We'll discuss the history and theory of the astrolabe and provide extensive hands-on practical experience. This year the focus will be on uses in Islamic culture. Details at http://astrolabeproject.com.
fee_itemization: Fee covers part of the cost of a large (~50 page) handout, and a paper astrolabe.

name: Introduction to Combat Archery
description_book: Learn the basics of combat archery. Covers the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules, and basic tactics.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to be a part of the action on the battlefield, but didn't want to swing a sword? Have you ever wanted to shoot back at that pesky archer who keeps killing you? Give combat archery a try. The class will cover the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules, and basic tactics.

name: Norse Underdress/Tunic Drafting & Period Stitches
description_book: Pattern drafting of early period underdress or tunic. Conserve fabric. Inset sleeves. Also covers stitches of the Norse period.
description_web: Learn how to conserve fabric and make a well-fitted dress or tunic. Pattern drafting. Inset sleeve math. We'll also go over different stitch finds and how they were used.

name: SCA 101
description_book: Newcomers: Learn about the history and structure of the Society for Creative Anachronism.
description_web: Newcomers: Learn about the history and structure of the Society for Creative Anachronism. How did the SCA begin? What is a Laurel? How many kingdoms are there? Find out the answers to these and many other questions newcomers often ask. Free handout; open to all ages.

name: *Kyōgen*: Small Troupe Comic Improv Theatre
description_book: Try out small troupe improvisational comic theatre. Stock characters with few sets or props. Short plays with burlesque, farce, satire, and slapstick.
description_web:
Try out small troupe medieval Japanese improvisational comic theatre. If you like over-the-top comic acting, then *kyōgen* is for you! Ridicule the powerful. Expose human foibles and social problems. Stock characters with minimal sets and props perform burlesque, farce, satire, and slapstick comedy. Learn about stock characters, theatrical devices, common themes, rhythmic structure, comic theory, and more!

*Kyōgen* is an accessible and easy-to-stage genre of Japanese theatre. *Kyōgen* dates to at least the fourteenth century and is a living theatre today. *Kyōgen* frequently lampooned the powerful people who sat in the audience. Learn about stage geography, scripting, types of plays, types of characters, acting conventions, and more. Discover *kyōgen* with as few as two speaking roles and plays lasting from ten minutes to an hour.
fee_itemization: The multi-page handout contains synopsis of period plays, character descriptions, stage drawing, and more.

location: Argent Fox (Merchant area behind the barn)
name: Harp for Absolute Beginners II
description_book: Basic harp Session II, following Session I! Please bring a harp if you have one and a chair if you need one. Prior experience not necessary. All ages.
description_web: A very basic introduction to the fundamentals of modern harp. This class will address using both hands at once. Please bring a harp if you have one and a chair if you need one; we will be holding the class at Argent Fox and can borrow his harps and chairs, but he only has so many and I don't know how many students will attend. We will review hand position and work on finger independence, going over a few basic exercises to practice with, and I will provide handouts with a simple tune to practice. Ability to either read music or memorize a definite plus, but anyone's welcome to show up, and I'll teach you what I can. All ages emphatically welcomed. This is the second in a sequence of two classes. Class is aimed at nylon-strung harps; wire-strung are welcome but I can't teach wire-strung style, though I will try to point you at people who can.

location: Argent Fox (Merchant area behind the barn)
name: Pulling the Right Strings (for Harps)
description_book: Have you ever wondered what to do with your left hand? Come join us as we figure out some *Greensleeves* chording.
description_web: Have you ever wondered what to do with your left hand? Come join us as we figure out some *Greensleeves* chording. We'll even talk about how to get around that pesky accidental. You will be able to apply the knowledge you learn in this class to any song that you can hum the melody for. This class is geared towards new harpers or people interested in the harp. Harps will be available for playing along.

name: Social Theory of *Commedia dell'Arte*
description_book: As stylized as morality plays but wholly secular, *commedia* strictly follows a single social perspective that defines all roles, motion, and plot.
description_web: Highly stylized, as morality plays were, but wholly secular and quotidian, late Renaissance professional comedy, or *commedia* strictly follows a single social perspective that defines everything on stage: all roles, conventions, motion, and plot. Before the invention of “characters”in the modern sense, and before the “fourth wall” was raised to divide players from the audience, *commedia* used roles representing selected social segments to mock the *nouveau riche* and the limits of their authority over their children, their servants, and the loose cannons of the newly-risen middle class - and thereby revealed our common underlying humanity and shared struggles in burgeoning late Renaissance urban life.

name: Weaving the Dance: *Tesara*
description_book: An advanced 15th-century performance dance for ten people mimicking the weaving of brocade. A visually stunning and exciting routine!
description_web: An advanced 15th-century performance dance for ten people mimicking the weaving of brocade. A visually stunning and exciting routine to be performed at the Feast of the Phoenix on War Tuesday!

name: Developing a Make-and-Take Class: Cheesemaking
description_book: Considering teaching a make-'n-take class? We'll walk through some of the elements of developing a class while making a simple cheese.
description_web: Make-and-take classes are popular, make excellent demos, and are a great hands-on way to teach a new skill. We will walk through some of the elements of developing your own make-and-take class project while demonstrating the process of making a simple cheese.

name: Heraldic Paper Dolls: Animal Attitude
description_book: There are any number of poses that a beast, bird, or monster can have in a coat of arms. Learn how to describe them while making your own paper doll!
description_web: There are any number of poses that a beast, bird, or monster can have in a coat of arms. Learn how to describe them while making your own paper doll!

name: Tinsmithing
description_book: A basic but complete course in the fundamentals of tinsmithing. Students will make a glass-globed hurricane lamp with hand tools.
description_web: A basic but complete course in the fundamentals of tinsmithing. Students will make a glass-globed hurricane lamp with hand tools.

instructor: Lady Cynthia Anne of Silver Lakes
name: Pennsic Youth Choir
description_book: Youth 12-19; rehearse 12-1 Sat-Wed; concert Thurs of War Week. Director Lady Cynthia Anne of Silver Lakes.
description_web: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 19 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music a cappella, with Lady Cynthia Anne of Silver Lakes. We will rehearse 12-1 pm Saturday, August 3, through Wednesday, August 7. Performance will be part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/8, in the PARC; 2PM) More information can be found here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-youth-choir

name: Basics of Flexible Weapons Fighting
description_book: Learn to fight with the techniques of the Filipino *sarong*, covering offensive and defensive techniques. No martial arts experience required.
description_web: Learn to fight with the techniques of the Filipino *sarong*, which can also be applied to other flexible items such as scarves or belts. Class will cover offensive and defensive techniques including blocks, traps and chokes. No martial arts experience or equipment required. Active participants limited to 10.

name: The Ink Won't Flow, The Paint Won't Go, What To Do
description_book: It's the little things that can make the difference in our scribal work, good and bad. Explore some common problems and how to deal with them.
description_web: It's the little things that can make the difference in our scribal work, good and bad. Explore some common problems and how to deal with them. Have an "oops" that needs fixing, or a problem that has you stumped? Bring it and we will work on it.

name: Open Scribal Time
description_book: Take advantage of our clean, well-lit space to work on existing projects or to try your hand at calligraphy and/or illumination.

name: Making Gauntlets: How to Make Them Work Right
description_book: Gauntlets and your hands: Learn how to properly design armor so that it follows the body instead of impeding your motion. Tricks of the trade.
description_web: We'll cover how to properly make and fit gauntlets so that they follow the motion of the body instead of impeding it. Historical and reproduction examples will be used (14th through the 16th century). Also includes a discussion of tricks of the trade that make the armorer's life easier.

name: Lampworking: Making SCA Order Medallions
description_book: Demo: how to make glass beads and pendants for Society and Kingdom (East) level awards. Brainstorm strategies for making other Order pendants.
description_web: This class will be a demonstration of how to make glass beads and pendants for Society and Kingdom (East) level awards. After a few demonstrations, attendees are invited to bring pictures of other awards they might wish to create themselves, and the class will brainstorm strategies for making those other designs as time allows. I have made Laurel and Pelican medallions, and pendants for East Kingdom awards such as the order of Maunche, Silver Crescent, and OGR, among others. Please note this class is a demonstration only. It is not hands-on. However, the instructor is happy to find a time/place to work one-on-one with interested students at another time during Pennsic.

name: Dangerous Obsession: Transmutational Alchemy
description_book: How transmutational alchemy was viewed in medieval Europe.
description_web: How transmutational alchemy was viewed in medieval Europe. This course surveys what alchemy was and wasn't in European history, who its adherents were, and what their practices were in the medieval period and into the late Renaissance.

name: Seasons and Cycles of Medieval Life
description_book: Examine the cycles which drove the medieval world: the seasons, the agricultural year, the church year, to show the broad outline of medieval life.
description_web: Seasons and cycles of medieval life, or "the rhythm method", examines the cycles which drove medieval life: the seasons, the agricultural year, the church year, light and dark, to show the broad outline of life in the medieval world.

name: How Thor Solves an Argument
description_book: Without Odin’s charisma and Loki’s wit, Thor resorts to his fists. Yet he is the most approachable and friendly of the family of the Norse gods.
description_web: Without Odin’s charisma and Loki’s wit, Thor resorts to his fists. Yet he is the most approachable and friendly of the family of the Norse gods.

name: Songwriting to Tell a Story
description_book: Principles and guidelines for constructing tight, compelling, original SCA-appropriate songs that capture and hold an audience.
description_web: Principles and guidelines for constructing tight, compelling, original, SCA-appropriate songs that capture (and hold) an audience. The focus is on lyrics, song and story structure. How is writing a good lyric different from writing a good poem? Create a singable story that is entertaining, engaging, and will hold the attention of a SCAdian audience, who enjoy period material, but still prefer a song that runs 5 minutes or under.

name: Children's Garb Roundtable
description_book: How to make inexpensive garb that can be modified as your child grows, including teen years. Share your tips, ideas and questions.
description_web: Join a discussion on how to make inexpensive garb for your child as they grow and that will grow with them. Share your tips, ideas and questions. Bring samples of your favorite go-to garb for your child. The handout will include ideas, websites, pictures that have been gleaned over the years. I will be including a Teen Edition as mine have gotten to that point.

name: SCA on a Budget
description_book: Getting **all the things** in the SCA can quickly make a prince a pauper. Find ways to help keep expenses to a reasonable amount.

name: Fabric Game Boards Make-and-Take
description_book: Use permanent markers or paint and fabric to make game boards. Board can be laundered. Materials provided at no cost.
description_web: Use permanent markers or paint and fabric to make game boards. Board can be laundered. Materials provided at no cost.

name: Bling Out Your Veils
description_book: Basic veil beading. You will leave class with a working knowledge of how to do simple veil beading. All supplies and veil will be supplied.
description_web: Basic veil beading. You will leave class with a working knowledge of how to do simple veil beading. Ten kits available. Other students may watch the class; there will be extra handouts. If you would like to attend, you can bring your own veil and beads, and take the class.
fee_itemization:
fabric for veil
beads
beading needle
thread

name: *Kamikaze* Battle
description_book: Three-hour unlimited resurrection battle. No War points, no prizes, just fighting.
description_web: Three-hour unlimited resurrection battle. No War points, no prizes, just fighting.

name: *Shogi* for Beginners (Japanese Chess)
description_book: A 120-minute class in how to play *Shogi*, or Japanese chess. History, rules, strategy and tactics; time left over for students to play afterwards.
description_web: A 120-minute class in how to play *Shogi*, or Japanese chess. History, rules, strategy and tactics; time left over for students to play afterwards. Five sets available for players.

location: Guild of St. Barbara Gunners Fly atop Mt Eislinn (Meeting at N17 Household of the White Rose Artillery Camp at corner of Battle Rd and Fosse Way to move equipment to theTop of Mt Eislin under the Gunners Red Fly. Bring chairs and water)
name: Guild of Saint Barbara Black Powder Training
description_book: Black powder safety and hands-on training. Bring pre-1600 firearms and cannon with you to be inspected. ***DO NOT BRING YOUR OWN POWDER***
description_web:
Muster at the Artillery Camp Household of the White Rose, corner of Battle Road and Fosse Way. Artillery Park is on the front lawn. We muster here so we can get pieces to the artillery point atop of Mt. Eislinn. The Guild of Saint Barbara will holding its hands-on training and safety inspection on the middle Saturday at 1 pm. The hands-on black powder training session is for new gentles who wish to learn and join us on the line, or as a refresher for those who would desire. 
Hands-on training will be from 1 pm to 4 pm. Please join us for this informative session and feel free to bring questions. And, if you have pre-1600 firearms, bring them with you to be inspected. Please **DO NOT** bring powder to Pennsic! Powder will be provided.

name: Achieving *Tarab* Revisited: Spirit of ME Dance
description_book: Lets explore the concept of *tarab* or “dancer’s high” once more through both discussion and dance. Wear comfortable clothes for dancing.
description_web: Have you ever felt a curious thrill when dancing, or that you’re “in the zone?” There’s an expression for that in Middle Eastern dance, and it’s an amazing experience. Let's explore the concept of *tarab* or “dancer’s high” through both discussion and dance, and possible ways to achieve it. Wear comfortable clothes for dancing (no coin belts please) and bring a chair/cushion or notebook for the discussion if you desire.  We will revisit material from last year, as well as add more time for dance exploration. No dance experience required, and feel free to bring examples of music you might like to share.

name: Late Period Rounds
description_book: Come help sing through (or listen to) some late period rounds.

name: *Kumihimo* Basics
description_book: *Kumihimo* is cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided.
description_web: *Kumihimo* is cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Tarl’s Little Polearm Tourney
description_book: Welcome to the 14th annual Tarl’s Little Polearm Tourney! Tourney is open to all inspected adult fighters, using Pennsic legal polearms.
description_web: Welcome to the 14th annual Tarl’s Little Polearm Tourney. Tourney is in a bear-pit format and open to all adult fighters. Fighters must be inspected and use Pennsic-legal polearms. Fighting starts at 1 pm and is in two 45-minute sections with a half-time show! So bring your sense of fun and your love of the One True Weapon’s Form!

name: Populace Range: Thrown Weapons Range Setup
description_book: Do you participate in thrown weapons? Come help us set up the range for all to enjoy! MITs encouraged to attend!
description_web: Do you participate in thrown weapons? Come help us set up the range for all to enjoy! MITs encouraged to attend! Do you want to learn how to set up a thrown weapons range for your next event or local practice? Come get real-time instruction and hands-on learning.

name: Your First Scroll
description_book: Want to become a scribe? Don’t know where to start? Come learn to make a basic scroll blank! Tools (pencils, paintbrushes, rulers) available for use.
fee_itemization: One page of bristol and a starter set of paint.

name: Roses, Part 1: Then and Now
description_book: A survey of roses that were available and/or cultivated during our period and how they compare to roses commonly grown today.

name: Defense Against Dark Rhetoric
description_book: Identifying and defending against the use of rhetorical fallacies which undermine fairness and ethical deliberation.
description_web: A guided discussion of the practical evil of the use of rhetorical fallacies which undermine fairness and ethical deliberation in private affairs and public policy development. The class will include a taxonomy (a framework for identifying and grouping) the kinds of sly lies with which we are daily beset and, by implication, ethical antidotes.

name: New Medieval Stories
description_book: I have written stories with a medieval background. They are suitable for ages 10 and above.
description_web: I have written stories with a medieval background. They are suitable for ages 10 and above. I wanted to share them with people who like the medieval period as much as I do.

name: A Suit of Armor Explained
description_book: An in-depth study of armor worn in England in the 13th century. Discussion will be guided by multiple sources and a reconstructed full suit of armor.

name: Basic Hand Sewing for Construction
description_book: Will teach four basic hand sewing stitches for sewing together anything. We will make a simple drawstring pouch to learn these stitches.
description_web: Will teach four basic hand sewing stitches for sewing together anything. We will make a simple drawstring pouch to learn these stitches. Bring scissors and a needle if you have them.

name: *Ljóðaháttr* and Drama in Scandinavia
description_book: We'll discuss *ljóðahátt*, a form of Old Norse poetry, both as a poetic form and as a possible step in the development of Scandinavian drama.
description_web: *Ljóðaháttr* is a form of Old Norse poetry sometimes called "Song Measure."  However, almost all extant *ljóðaháttr* is some form of speech, i.e., monologue or dialogue. Some Old Norse scholars speculate as to the role of *ljóðaháttr* in developing drama. We will be discussing *ljóðaháttr* both as a poetic form and as a possible step in the development of Scandinavian drama.

name: Deeper Look at Textiles & Trim of Viking Age Dress
description_book: By investigating extant textiles, this class will aid in making informed choices for selecting fabrics and adding details to Viking Age garments.
description_web: By looking deeper at both the textiles and the details from extant items, this class aims to help individuals make informed choices for crafting their garments. Textile examples will clarify the weaves and weight of period fabrics and there will also be discussion of possible modern substitutions. Additionally, practical details for finishing or embellishing garments will be explored and their history investigated. The goal of this class is to help the individual understand how daily life during the Viking Age could affect how textiles were crafted and worn.
fee_itemization: A link will be provided for download for free.  Hardcopy in color will be $25 (60 page document that is mostly in color that is bound with indexed tabs).

name: Medieval Technology and Social Change
description_book: The development and dissemination of a variety of key technologies throughout the early Middle Ages.
description_web: Contrary to many people's impressions, there was a great deal of technology available and in use during the Middle Ages. This class will present the development and dissemination of a variety of key technologies throughout the early Middle Ages. Handouts will be provided.

name: Viking Gender Roles
description_book: Popular culture presents one idea of Vikings' gender, but does it reflect what historical sources tell us? **Age 18+.**
description_web:
The idea of the Viking warrior is a strong cultural idiom that pervades medievalism, especially in the early period. In some ways, this idea of a violent, gruff raider taking riches and assaulting women reflects in our modern society as a symbol of masculinity gone wrong, and medieval Christian writers certainly want us to believe they were savage outsiders with no place in society. But how did Norse society look from the inside? What about women? What do we know about the expected gender roles and how they were enforced? What happened to those who deviated? Class will discuss the evidence we have from a variety of sources, and provide possible interpretations of that evidence.

Please be aware that the class will discuss sex, sexual abuse, and violence, especially violence directed at sexual and gender minorities. Content warnings will be offered around the most sensitive sections. **Age 18+.**

name: Songs of Sorrow: *Ladino/Sephardic* Song
description_book: Practical introduction to the music of the medieval Spanish Jews. Includes history, pronunciation, ornamentation, and 3-5 period songs.
description_web:
